Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.name: Acidic Poison Cloud Trap
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.hpDetails: to destroy a nozzle; Tank Hardness 20; TankHP 100 (BT 50) to damage the tank enough to stop it from spewing gas
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.descriptionHazard: Five nozzles hidden across the apartment's ceiling spew thick clouds of acidic poison from a reinforced tank behind the wall.
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:35|name:Block One Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to block one of the nozzles or @Check[thievery|dc:40|name:Shut Off the Tank|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to shut off the tank. The trap deactivates after 5 rounds, once the tank is empty.
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.routine: (1 action) When it's triggered, the trap has five active nozzles, but at the end of its turn each round, one random nozzle deactivates. On the trap's turn, the active nozzles emit a cloud of acidic poison gas that expands to fill the apartment. The cloud deals @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage and @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage per active nozzle to each creature and object in the room (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic|name:Spew Cloud|traits:poison] save). Unattended objects automatically fail saves to avoid the damage.

action->Spew Cloud.name: Spew Cloud
action->Spew Cloud.description:
Trigger Twelve seconds have passed since the door to the apartment was opened

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

Agent of the Gray Queen.name: Agent of the Gray Queen
Agent of the Gray Queen.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Agradaemon.name: Agradaemon
Agradaemon.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair an agradaemon's vision; it ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Alchemical Reaction.name: Alchemical Reaction
action->Alchemical Reaction.description:
Trigger The alchemical horror takes damage from an alchemical bomb

Effect The volatile substances that compose the alchemical horror froth outward as they react with the bomb. The bomb's full effects affect creatures in every space within 15 feet of the alchemical horror, and splash damage affects creatures 5 feet beyond that.

action->Alchemical Torrent.name: Alchemical Torrent
action->Alchemical Torrent.description:
The alchemical horror spews a torrent of alchemical fluids in a @Template[cone|distance:30] that deals @Damage[20d6[acid]] damage to creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic] save).

The alchemical horror can't use this ability again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Alchemical Torrent]]{1d4 rounds}.

weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).name: Acid Flask (Moderate)
weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 2d6 persistent acid damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Tanglefoot Bag (Moderate).name: Tanglefoot Bag (Moderate)
weapon->Tanglefoot Bag (Moderate).description:
Activate 1 Strike

A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a -15-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls, and the Escape DC is 19.

On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

action->Magic Susceptibility.name: Magic Susceptibility
action->Magic Susceptibility.description:
An almiraj takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against occult spells.

Any beneficial occult spells with a duration of 1 round or longer cast on the almiraj last twice as long.

weapon->Light Mace.name: Light Mace
weapon->Light Mace.description: A light mace has a short wooden or metal shaft ending with a dense metal head. Used much like a club, it delivers heavy bludgeoning blows, but with extra power derived from the head's metal ridges or spikes.

weapon->Bottled Lightning (Moderate).name: Bottled Lightning (Moderate)
weapon->Bottled Lightning (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals 2d6 electricity damage and 2 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of your next turn. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Rapier.name: Rapier
weapon->Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

shield->Wooden Shield.name: Wooden Shield
shield->Wooden Shield.description:
Though they come in a variety of shapes and sizes, the protection offered by wooden shields comes from the stoutness of their materials. While wooden shields are less expensive than steel shields, they break more easily.

Hardness HP BT
3 12 6

armor->Splint Mail.name: Splint Mail
armor->Splint Mail.description: This type of armor is chain mail reinforced with flexible, interlocking metal plates, typically located on the wearer's torso, upper arms, and legs. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor (see above) and a pair of gauntlets.

Arcane Feedback Trap.name: Arcane Feedback Trap
Arcane Feedback Trap.descriptionHazard: A spike of stone bursts from the south wall and quickly retracts.
Arcane Feedback Trap.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:33|name:Quell Rippling Stone] (master) to quell the rippling stone or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level, counteract DC 31) to dispel the magical feedback.

action->Stone Spike.name: Stone Spike
action->Stone Spike.description:
Trigger A creature in area E1 casts an arcane spell or uses an arcane ability

Effect The trap makes a stone spike attack against the triggering creature. For the next 1 minute thereafter, the ripples are stronger, giving the trap a +2 circumstance bonus on stone spike Strikes during this time.

weapon->+1 Striking Dagger.name: +1 Striking Dagger
weapon->+1 Striking Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

action->Prickly Defense.name: Prickly Defense
action->Prickly Defense.description:
The avarek withdraws beneath its spines, presenting a defensive, spiky exterior. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to spine Strikes and AC. Any adjacent creature that attempts a melee attack against the avarek takes 1d6 piercing damage per attack, regardless of whether the attack hits.

Prickly Defense lasts until the avarek uses a move action or makes a Strike with any weapon other than its spines.

Avsheros the Betrayer.name: Avsheros the Betrayer
Avsheros the Betrayer.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

weapon->+3 Major Striking Greatsword (La.name: +3 Major Striking Greatsword (Large)
weapon->+3 Major Striking Greatsword (La.description: This immense two-handed sword is nearly as tall as its wielder. Its lower blade is often somewhat dulled to allow it to be gripped for extra leverage in close-quarter fights.

Baatamidar.name: Baatamidar
Baatamidar.publicNotes: Baatamidars are drawn to destroy planar communities on the fringes where the Outer Planes touch the chaos of the Maelstrom. They resemble floating blobs of undulating, prismatic ooze with four quivering tentacles and dribbles of oily slime that always drip upwards.

action->Tear Flesh.name: Tear Flesh
action->Tear Flesh.description:
Trigger A creature grabbed by the barnacle ghoul critically fails a skill check to Escape

Effect The barnacle ghoul makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Integrated Launcher.name: Integrated Launcher
action->Integrated Launcher.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

action->Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
action->Wind-Up.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again.The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:33|name:Wind Down|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

action->Poison Ink.name: Poison Ink
action->Poison Ink.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 round).

action->Rapid Repair.name: Rapid Repair
action->Rapid Repair.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher
action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.description: The clockwork assassin launches a smoke bomb. A screen of thick, opaque smoke fills a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 60 feet of the clockwork assassin. Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The clockwork assassin's Strikes deal an additional 3d6+4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

weapon->+1 Greatpick.name: +1 Greatpick
weapon->+1 Greatpick.description: This pick has a longer handle and broader head than a regular pick. It is too heavy to wield in one hand.

weapon->Longspear.name: Longspear
weapon->Longspear.description: This very long spear, sometimes called a pike, is purely for thrusting rather than throwing. Used by many soldiers and city watch for crowd control and defense against charging enemies, it must be wielded with two hands.

weapon->Sling.name: Sling
weapon->Sling.description: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

armor->Scale Mail.name: Scale Mail
armor->Scale Mail.description: Scale mail consists of many metal scales sewn onto a reinforced leather backing, often in the form of a long shirt that protects the torso, arms, and legs.

consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).name: Healing Potion (Lesser)
consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(2d8+5)[healing]] Hit Points.

consumable->Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
consumable->Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

action->Haphazard Hack.name: Haphazard Hack
action->Haphazard Hack.description:
Requirements Rekarek is adjacent to two or more enemies

Effect Rekarek makes three melee weapon Strikes, two of which must be against different enemies.

These attacks count toward her multiple attack penalty, but only after all three Strikes have been made.

After taking this activity, Rekarek is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of her next turn.

action->Delay Condition.name: Delay Condition
action->Delay Condition.description: The binumir's dual spirit takes longer to be affected by detrimental effects. When the binumir is the target of an effect that imparts the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition, the condition is automatically suppressed until the end of the binumir's next turn.

weapon->Shortbow.name: Shortbow
weapon->Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

armor->Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
armor->Chain Mail.description: A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->No Escape.name: No Escape
action->No Escape.description:
Trigger An enemy within reach of the Black Whale guard attempts to move away

Effect The guard Strides up to their Speed, following the enemy and keeping the enemy in reach throughout its movement until the enemy stops moving or the guard moves their full Speed.

action->Clobber.name: Clobber
action->Clobber.description: The guard makes a club Strike. On a hit, if the target is off-guard, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or be stunned 2.

action->Hammering Flurry.name: Hammering Flurry
action->Hammering Flurry.description: The guard makes three club Strikes against a single target, ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after all three attacks are completed.

action->Shatter Defenses.name: Shatter Defenses
action->Shatter Defenses.description:
Requirements A frightened creature is within melee reach of the Black Whale guard

Effect The guard makes a melee Strike against the frightened creature. If they hit and deal damage, the target becomes off-guard as long as it's frightened. If the target is already off-guard, it can't reduce its frightened value below 1 until the start of the guard's next turn.

weapon->Shortbow.name: Shortbow
weapon->Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

armor->Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
armor->Chain Mail.description: A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

action->Nightmare Assault.name: Nightmare Assault
action->Nightmare Assault.description:
Frequency Once per day

The prison guard makes a club Strike. On a hit, the target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and becomes immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is plagued by nightmarish visiona and becomes fatigued.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} until no longer fatigued

action->Shatter Defenses.name: Shatter Defenses
action->Shatter Defenses.description:
Requirements A frightened creature is within melee reach of the Black Whale guard

Effect The guard makes a melee Strike against the frightened creature. If they hit and deal damage, the target becomes off-guard as long as it's frightened. If the target is already off-guard, it can't reduce its frightened value below 1 until the start of the guard's next turn.

Blackfinger's Prayer.name: Blackfinger's Prayer
Blackfinger's Prayer.descriptionHazard: The trapdoor's metal is infused with a deadly toxin that seeps out when the trap is triggered.
Blackfinger's Prayer.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:50|name:Gum Up Trapdoor|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to gum up the trapdoor's porous metal surface, @Check[crafting|dc:45|name:Render Toxin Inert] (master) to render the toxin inert, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 45) to counteract the trap's magic

action->Blackfinger's Prayer.name: Blackfinger's Prayer
action->Blackfinger's Prayer.description:
Trigger A creature opens the door without first whispering the name Blackfingers

Effect The metal trapdoor emits toxic vapors. Each creature within 30 feet must save against a potent strain of Blackfinger Blight.

action->Blackfinger Blight.name: Blackfinger Blight
action->Blackfinger Blight.description:
Each round, at the beginning of their turn, a creature affected by blackfinger blight must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or drop one random item they're holding

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:40]

Onset 1 round

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 round)

equipment->Religious Symbol of Norgorber.name: Religious Symbol of Norgorber
equipment->Religious Symbol of Norgorber.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

consumable->Bolts (Poisoned with Giant S.name: Bolts (Poisoned with Giant Scorpion Venom)
consumable->Bolts (Poisoned with Giant S.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.QGXNqpP5KvSldoZz]{Giant Scorpion Venom}

Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Cast Down.name: Cast Down
action->Cast Down.description: When the acolyte casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm} to damage one creature, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} if it takes any damage from the spell. If the creature critically fails its save against the spell, it also takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 minute.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The acolyte deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

weapon->+1 Striking Club.name: +1 Striking Club
weapon->+1 Striking Club.description: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->+1 Leather Armor.name: +1 Leather Armor
armor->+1 Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Brutish Shove.name: Brutish Shove
action->Brutish Shove.description:
Throwing your weight behind your attack, you hit your opponent hard enough to make it stumble back. Make a Strike with a two-handed melee weapon. If you hit a target that is your size or smaller, that creature is off-guard until the end of your current turn, and you can automatically Shove it, with the same benefits as the Shove action (including the critical success effect, if your Strike was a critical hit). If you move to follow the target, your movement doesn't trigger reactions. This Strike has the following failure effect.

Failure The target becomes off-guard until the end of your current turn.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The goon deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

weapon->Heavy Crossbow.name: Heavy Crossbow
weapon->Heavy Crossbow.description: This large crossbow is harder to load and more substantial than a regular crossbow, but it packs a greater punch.

weapon->+1 Striking Shovel.name: +1 Striking Shovel
weapon->+1 Striking Shovel.description: Derived from a farming tool used to mow down long grains and cereals, this weapon has a long wooden shaft with protruding handles, capped with a curved blade set at a right angle.

weapon->Tanglefoot Bag (Moderate).name: Tanglefoot Bag (Moderate)
weapon->Tanglefoot Bag (Moderate).description:
Activate 1 Strike

A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a -15-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls, and the Escape DC is 19.

On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

weapon->Rapier.name: Rapier
weapon->Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

equipment->Ring of Manical Devices (Grea.name: Ring of Manical Devices (Greater) (Fireball)
equipment->Ring of Manical Devices (Grea.description:
This ring seems like simple tarnished brass, but it enhances your curiosity about traps and devices of all kinds.

You can use an Interact action to pull a set of thieves' tools from the ring. These tools appear in your hand and fold back into the ring if they would leave your possession.

They grant you a +3 item bonus to Thievery checks to Disable a Device and to Pick a Lock, and the ring's insights grant you the same bonus to Crafting checks to Craft and Repair snares and traps.

Activate 10 minutes (Interact)

Frequency once per day

Effect You create a 8th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o0l57UfBm9ScEUMW]{Rune Trap} containing your choice of either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{Prismatic Spray} or 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball}.

You can have only one glyph of warding from a ring of maniacal devices active at a time, even if you have multiple rings, and the spell ends if you lose your investiture in the ring.

rules.0: Ring of Maniacal Devices (Disable Devices and Pick a Lock)
rules.1: Ring of Maniacal Devices (Craft snares and traps)
rules.2: Ring of Maniacal Devices (Repair snares and traps)

equipment->Wand of Widening (7th-Level P.name: Wand of Widening (7th-Level Prismatic Spray)
equipment->Wand of Widening (7th-Level P.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{Prismatic Spray}

The end of this wand is forked instead of tapered.

Activate Cast a Spell; The activation takes 2 if the spell normally takes 1 to cast, or 3 if the spell normally take 2

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell, and increase its area. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet; add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller; or add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of a spell of the appropriate rank. The spell must have a casting time of 1 or 2, can't have a duration, and must have an area of burst (10 feet or more), cone, or line.

consumable->Scroll of Monstrosity Form (.name: Scroll of Monstrosity Form (Level 8)
consumable->Scroll of Monstrosity Form (.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8AMvNVOUEtxBCDvJ]{Monstrosity Form}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

action->Illusory Copies.name: Illusory Copies
action->Illusory Copies.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Blune calls into existence [[/r 1d4+2 #illusory copies]] illusory copies of himself, which dance around him and copy his every movement, making it almost impossible to pinpoint the true Blune.

Any attack that would hit Blune has a random chance of hitting an illusory copy instead. This effect lasts for up to 1 minute or until all the copies are destroyed or Blune is incapacitated.

Once a copy is hit, it's destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit Blune's AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys a copy but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit a copy, the copy is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against Blune.

Once all the copies are destroyed, this ability ends.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Blune deals an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Ferocious Devotion.name: Ferocious Devotion
action->Ferocious Devotion.description:
When an illusory toady is destroyed, it dissolves into a puddle of cerulean quintessence before reforming to quasi-life once more. One round after it is destroyed, the toady starts re-forming. One round after that, the toady is completely healed and begins to fight once more.

If damaged while it is re-forming but before the process is complete, the toady is destroyed but splits into two cerulean puddles that begin re-forming into two identical toadies 1 round later, each with half the maximum HP of the original toady (this is similar to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.uQBOJfjtzEXvpLQz]{Ochre Jelly's} Split ability); the toadies begin re-forming 1 round later.

The toadies are permanently destroyed only by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ihbRf964JDXztcy3]{Disjunction} or if @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.agents-of-edgewatch-bestiary.Actor.sUrJ7jxzBiJTbwVo]{Blune} falls unconscious.

action->Amplify Spell.name: Amplify Spell
action->Amplify Spell.description:
The toady wills itself to become a conduit for Blune's next spell, empowering the spell.

The toady becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until the beginning of its next turn.

If Blune Bandersworth is within 30 feet and Casts a Spell before the toady's next turn, the spell travels through the toady before redirecting toward its intended target.

The spell is heightened by 1 rank, to a maximum of 10th rank. The toady is then destroyed.

Boiling Fountains.name: Boiling Fountains
Boiling Fountains.descriptionHazard: Four pressure plates beneath the floorboards activate dragon-headed fountains on either side of the room, which spray boiling water across the area between them.
Boiling Fountains.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disable each pressure plate, @Check[thievery|dc:16|name:Jam Fountain|traits:action:disable-a-device] to jam each fountain, or @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Deflect Fountain's Spray|traits:action:disable-a-device] to deflect a fountain's spray
Boiling Fountains.reset: Once a pressure plate has been activated, it must be reset manually.

action->Scalding Spray.name: Scalding Spray
action->Scalding Spray.description:
Trigger Weight is placed on one of the squares marked with "T" on the map, triggering a pressure plate

Effect The fountains spray boiling water across their own squares and the 10-foot-by-20-foot area between them (marked with dotted lines), dealing @Damage[(4d6+4)[fire]] damage to any creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

Boiling Tub Trap.name: Boiling Tub Trap
Boiling Tub Trap.descriptionHazard: A snapped trip wire causes an alchemical bomb to detonate and blow up part of the tin tub, spilling boiling water all over the trap's victim.
Boiling Tub Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:32|name:Remove Trip Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to safely remove the trip wire from the bomb

action->Overflowing Boiling Water.name: Overflowing Boiling Water
action->Overflowing Boiling Water.description:
Trigger The trip wire is pulled or severed

Effect An acid flask detonates, spraying acid at nearby creatures and causing the tub of boiling water to burst in the same direction.

All creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:5] east of the triggered boiling tub trap take @Damage[3d6[persistent,acid],(3[splash])[acid],(8d6+20)[fire]]{3d6 persistent acid damage, 3 acid splash damage, and 8d6+20 fire damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:31|basic|traits:acid,fire] save).

weapon->Battle Axe.name: Battle Axe
weapon->Battle Axe.description: These axes are designed explicitly as weapons, rather than tools. They typically weigh less, with a shaft reinforced with metal bands or bolts, and have a sharper blade, making them ideal for chopping limbs rather than wood.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

action->Rage.name: Rage
action->Rage.description:
Requirements Bolar isn't fatigued or raging

Effect Bolar gains 3 temporary Hit Points that last until the rage ends. While raging, he deals 2 additional damage with melee attacks and takes a -1 penalty to AC. The rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies Bolar can perceive, or until Bolar falls unconscious.

Once the rage ends, Bolar can't Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

action->Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet
action->Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A bone skipper swarm identifies bones and creatures with a skeletal system in the listed range.

action->Marrow Rot.name: Marrow Rot
action->Marrow Rot.description:
Marrow rot affects only creatures with a skeletal system

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

action->Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
action->Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic]) save plus exposure to marrow rot.

action->Partial Amphibian.name: Partial Amphibian
action->Partial Amphibian.description: The bregdi can breathe air for up to 10 minutes, or up to an hour so long as its skin remains wet.

Burning Chandelier Trap.name: Burning Chandelier Trap
Burning Chandelier Trap.descriptionHazard: Four large flaming chandeliers swing wildly around the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:36|name:Disable a Chandelier|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a chandelier or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 33) to permanently drain the magic from a chandelier. Any amount of cold damage that overcomes a chandelier's cold resistance extinguishes its flames and removes its persistent fire damage and flame dart attack. @Check[thievery|dc:41|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to disable the entire trap from the hidden control panel in the southeast corner of the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no living creatures remaining in the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.routine: (4 actions) For every chandelier disabled, the trap's actions are reduced by 1. For each of the trap's actions, a different chandelier attacks a random creature in the room. A chandelier uses its swinging chandelier attack if it can, but it can't make melee attacks against creatures in the cage, the closet, or the gap between the two double doors leading into the vault. Against a creature it can't reach with a melee attack, it uses a flame dart attack instead. The trap doesn't take multiple attack penalties.
Burning Chandelier Trap.stealth: (master) or @Check[perception|dc:38|traits:action:seek] (master) to spot the trap's control panel

action->Extending Chandeliers.name: Extending Chandeliers
action->Extending Chandeliers.description:
Trigger A creature touches the cage door, the closet door, or any wooden stand

Effect Both double doors leading out of the room shut and lock; while the trap is active, the key doesn't work to open these doors (although their locks can be picked normally). The chandeliers drop several feet on elongated chains, allowing them to swing around the room. The closest chandelier to the triggering creature makes a swinging chandelier Strike against it. The trap then rolls initiative.

weapon->+1 Striking Heavy Crossbow.name: +1 Striking Heavy Crossbow
weapon->+1 Striking Heavy Crossbow.description: This large crossbow is harder to load and more substantial than a regular crossbow, but it packs a greater punch.

weapon->+2 Greater Striking axiomatic Sc.name: +2 Greater Striking axiomatic Scourge
weapon->+2 Greater Striking axiomatic Sc.description: A scourge-also known as a cat-o'-nine-tails-is a set of several knotted cords made from cotton or leather and attached to a handle. While most scourges are more suitable for torture than combat, the weapons used by the Order of the Scourge have metal barbs woven in to pierce clothing and armor. The scourge is a martial melee weapon.

armor->+2 Resilient Hellknight Plate.name: +2 Resilient Hellknight Plate
armor->+2 Resilient Hellknight Plate.description: Few armors in the Inner Sea region are as memorable as the iconic Hellknight plate. While each order has its own flourishes, Hellknight plate is instantly recognizable to any who know of the Hellknights. Hellknights go to extreme measures to punish non-Hellknights who get their hands on Hellknight plate, and the reward is not usually worth the risk, since for non-Hellknights, the armor is functionally similar to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Gq1cZWSKOtJhKd2p]{Full Plate}.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Diabolic Certitude.name: Diabolic Certitude
action->Diabolic Certitude.description: When making a Recall Knowledge check about a devil she's observing, whenever Calennia rolls a critical failure, she gets a failure instead.

action->Flog Mercilessly.name: Flog Mercilessly
action->Flog Mercilessly.description: Calennia Strikes with her scourge. On a hit, she rolls damage three times. This damage is combined (for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance, for example).

action->Terrible Justice.name: Terrible Justice
action->Terrible Justice.description:
Trigger A living creature within 30 feet is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Calennia targets the creature with a death knell spell (DC 34). If the target dies, all of Calennia's enemies within 60 feet are targeted by a fear spell (DC 34). A creature that succeeds at either save is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

spell->Project Image (At Will) (See Proj.name: Project Image (At Will) (See Project False Image)

action->Disgorge Portal.name: Disgorge Portal
action->Disgorge Portal.description:
The camarach vomits a spray of coruscating light. This has the effect of a DC 42 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{Prismatic Spray}, except that each creature is affected by one violet beam and one other beam (roll 1d6 instead of 1d8 to determine which other beam).

The camarach can't Disgorge a Portal again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Disgorge a Portal]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Exile.name: Exile
action->Exile.description:
The camarach shunts one creature within its body through an inner portal to send it away.

The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save.

Critical Success The creature is teleported to an open space it chooses within 30 feet of the camarach.

Success The creature isn't teleported.

Failure The creature is teleported to a random open space 1 mile from the camarach.

Critical Failure The creature is teleported to a random other plane, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}.

action->Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
action->Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The camarach Grabs a creature

Effect The camarach uses Swallow Whole.

action->Project False Image.name: Project False Image
action->Project False Image.description: When the camarach casts project image, its illusory image can be another creature of its size or a structure of its size that features a large portal (such as a freestanding archway or a large hut with an open doorway).

Canopy Drop.name: Canopy Drop
Canopy Drop.descriptionHazard: A trapdoor, connected to floor sensors, opens in the section of floor marked on the map, while the surrounding floor suddenly tilts to a 45-degree angle and the fountains in the wall begin spraying at high pressure, making the tile slippery and pushing creatures toward the open chute.
Canopy Drop.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|name:Jam Trapdoor Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the mechanisms and keep the trapdoor from opening, or to locate the bypass switch hidden under a stair riser just outside the room

action->Flush.name: Flush
action->Flush.description:
Trigger Two or more creatures stand on the trapped spaces

Effect One round after the trap is triggered, all creatures in the room fall 40 feet down the shaft to area E36, taking @Damage[20[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage from the fall plus @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage as they land in the spiked pit.

The creatures can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to snag the hammock or one of the hanging storage containers to avoid falling.

The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls or Grab an Edge is 20.

Carvey.name: Carvey
Carvey.publicNotes: Made of odd scraps of skin and muscle, a flesh golem is a grotesque parody of life. Though it has no mind, it can still go into a berserk rage when harmed, giving it a faint semblance of emotion. Flesh golems guard the laboratories and charnel houses of fleshwarpers and necromancers who feel no compunctions about desecrating corpses for their own ends. Though the first flesh golem is believed to have been a misguided attempt to create from simple base elements, these monstrosities are far from human. In isolated cases, echoes of a personality might rise in a flesh golem if the brain used as part of its construction belonged to a particularly powerful personality, but such tragic instances are rare in the extreme.

action->Suicidal Obedience.name: Suicidal Obedience
action->Suicidal Obedience.description:
Carvey is unerringly loyal to the Skinsaw cult and to Mobana especially. When Carvey goes berserk, she doesn't attack the nearest living creature or object but instead moves adjacent to the creature nearest the balcony (or similar falling hazard, if the battle is taking place elsewhere) and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the creature over the cliff's edge.

The number of feet Carvey can Shove a creature is doubled as long as Carvey has 40 or fewer HP (thus, she pushes a creature 10 feet on a sucessful check and 20 feet on a critical success), but she must move the same distance and in the same direction as the pushed creature.

If the shoved creature falls over the cliff's edge, so does Carvey.

action->Berserk.name: Berserk
action->Berserk.description:
A severely damaged flesh golem has a chance of going berserk.

If it has 40 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.

action->Electric Reflexes.name: Electric Reflexes
action->Electric Reflexes.description:
Trigger The golem takes electricity damage and a creature is adjacent to it.

Effect The golem lashes out and tries to grab a nearby creature. The golem attempts an Athletics check to [[/act grapple]] an adjacent creature. The creature also takes @Damage[3d6[electricity]] damage on a success, or @Damage[6d6[electricity]] damage on a critical success.

action->Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
action->Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by fire (@Damage[5d8[untyped]], @Damage[3d4[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by electricity (area @Damage[2d4[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

action->Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone.name: Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone
action->Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify} spell on the flesh golem affects the golem normally.

action->Berserk Slam.name: Berserk Slam
action->Berserk Slam.description:
Requirement The flesh golem is berserk.

Effect The flesh golem Strikes with its fist at a -1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals 1d6 extra damage and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

weapon->+1 Striking Sap.name: +1 Striking Sap
weapon->+1 Striking Sap.description: A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon's purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.

armor->Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
armor->Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

action->Escort from the Premises.name: Escort from the Premises
action->Escort from the Premises.description:
Requirements The casino bouncer has Grabbed a Medium or smaller target and is wielding a nonlethal weapon in the other hand

Effect The casino bouncer makes a Strike against the grabbed target with the nonlethal weapon. If the Strike hits, it deals damage as usual and the casino bouncer moves the target 5 feet (this is forced movement) and Steps into the space the target had just occupied.

action->Intimidating Stare.name: Intimidating Stare
action->Intimidating Stare.description:
The casino bouncer attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.nEwqNNWX6scLt4sc]{Demoralize} a creature with a mere glance. The casino bouncer doesn't take a penalty to their Intimidation check if the target doesn't speak the same language.

If the bouncer rolls a critical success, the target can't reduce the value of its frightened condition until [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} have passed.

Chalky.name: Chalky
Chalky.publicNotes: This golem is a walking alchemical nightmare capable of inflicting all manner of painful wounds. Its ability to follow orders is granted by the otherwise mindless humanoid brain that floats in its dome-like head. In exceptionally rare cases, the brain used in its creation might retain fragments of memories or even actual intellect, resulting in an alchemical golem with a personality and agenda of its own.

action->Alchemical Chambers.name: Alchemical Chambers
action->Alchemical Chambers.description:
An alchemical golem's body contains six alchemical chambers filled with different substances. When an alchemical golem ability calls upon a randomly determined alchemical effect, roll 1d6 and consult the following :

[[/gmr 1d6 #Alchemical Effect]] Alchemical Effect
1

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}
2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.T4ouD4mVFHA3EHs6]{Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser)}
3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.oCuwJ9IUDAuzsUwa]{Bravo's Brew (Moderate)}
4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bQPRKEpnLakJBAAh]{Cat's Eye Elixir}
5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.AqLxu3ir4UGzdOaz]{Cheetah's Elixir (Moderate)}
6 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TMtQnY6yvIRCpK9v]{Juggernaut Mutagen (Greater)}

action->Alchemical Rupture.name: Alchemical Rupture
action->Alchemical Rupture.description:
When an alchemical golem takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a @Template[emanation|distance:5].

Roll on the alchemical chambers list to determine which one shatters - all creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:5] are affected by the elixir in the randomly rolled alchemical chamber, and these creatures may forego their Reflex saves against the effect if they wish.

action->Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
action->Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by sonic (@Damage[5d8[untyped]], @Damage[2d6[untyped]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by acid (area @Damage[2d4[healing]] HP); slowed by cold

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

action->Vulnerable to Shatter.name: Vulnerable to Shatter
action->Vulnerable to Shatter.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell on an alchemical golem affects the golem normally, but also causes an alchemical rupture.

action->Alchemical Injection.name: Alchemical Injection
action->Alchemical Injection.description:
When an alchemical golem hits a creature with a syringe Strike, roll 1d6 on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack.

Chalky's alchemical chambers are filled with helpful potions and elixirs rather than harmful substances. When Chalky targets an ally with its syringe Strike, the ally takes no damage and doesn't need to make a save against the rolled effect.

action->Adamantine Strikes.name: Adamantine Strikes
action->Adamantine Strikes.description: Chaos Gulgamodh's body—including the appendages it uses to make melee Strikes—is made of adamantine.

action->Cannon Fusillade.name: Cannon Fusillade
action->Cannon Fusillade.description:
Chaos Gulgamodh unleashes a salvo of explosive blasts in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[(10d10+20)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic] save).

On a failed save, a creature is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave} effect. On a critically failed save, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Chaos Gulgamodh can't use Cannon Fusillade again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Cannon Fusillade]]{1d4 rounds}.

weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.name: +1 Striking Shortsword
weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

action->Split.name: Split
action->Split.description: When a child of venom is hit by an attack that would deal slashing or piercing damage and the child of venom has at least 20 HP, the creature splits into two identical children of venom with half the original's HP. One child of venom is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, they automatically push creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The child of venom deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Efficient Winding.name: Efficient Winding
action->Efficient Winding.description:
For the clockwork amalgam to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 7 days, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again.

The amalgam can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:33|name:Wind Down|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device to wind the amalgam down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the amalgam is in standby mode.

action->Recalibrate.name: Recalibrate
action->Recalibrate.description: The clockwork amalgam can recalibrate its internal structure to shed damaged components and replace them with new ones, restoring 125 HP to the construct. Each time it uses this ability, the clockwork amalgam permanently deactivates one of its five melee attacks as the components from that arm reassemble within the core of the machine.

action->Whirring Doom.name: Whirring Doom
action->Whirring Doom.description:
Frequency once per round

The clockwork amalgam becomes a blur of spinning weaponry. It makes up to five melee Strikes (one for each active melee attack it has available), taking a -4 penalty to the attack roll for each attack, but ignoring the multiple attack penalty until it has made all of its attacks. It can use each melee attack only once and it can target each creature in reach only once. If the clockwork amalgam used Whirring Doom in the previous round, it can use it again this round using only 1 action instead of 3. The amalgam's movement Speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

Clockwork Arms.name: Clockwork Arms
Clockwork Arms.descriptionHazard: Four claw-tipped clockwork arms suspended from the ceiling pick up and deposit creatures into a nearby hatch.
Clockwork Arms.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43|name:Deactivate One Arm|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam and deactivate one of the arms or @Check[athletics|dc:46|name:Tear Arm Off Machine] (legendary) to tear an arm off the machine.
Clockwork Arms.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action per arm destroyed or disabled. On its turn, the trap makes claw Strikes against creatures other than the Rumormonger or the Inkmaster. If an arm already has a creature grabbed, the trap spends 2 actions to use its Open Hatch ability.

action->Arm Activation.name: Arm Activation
action->Arm Activation.description:
Trigger The Rumormonger or the Inkmaster enters the room

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

action->Open Hatch.name: Open Hatch
action->Open Hatch.description: The metal hatch opens and the arms deposit a grabbed Medium or smaller creature into the hole. The creature becomes caught in the gears (see Caught in Gears) for 1 round before emerging in area K5. Reset Rewinding the gears for [[/br 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes} resets the trap.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Integrated Launcher.name: Integrated Launcher
action->Integrated Launcher.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

action->Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
action->Wind-Up.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:31|name:Wind Down|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

action->Rapid Repair.name: Rapid Repair
action->Rapid Repair.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher
action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.description: The clockwork assassin launches a smoke bomb. A screen of thick, opaque smoke fills a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 60 feet of the clockwork assassin. Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The clockwork assassin's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Integrated Launcher.name: Integrated Launcher
action->Integrated Launcher.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

action->Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
action->Wind-Up.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:33|name:Wind Down|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

action->Rapid Repair.name: Rapid Repair
action->Rapid Repair.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

action->Smoke Bomb Launcher.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher

Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The clockwork assassin's Strikes deal an additional 3d6+4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Clockwork Poison Bomb.name: Clockwork Poison Bomb
Clockwork Poison Bomb.hpDetails: to ruin the nozzle (making it impossible to disable, in which case the only way to disarm the bomb is to destroy both its tanks); Tank Hardness 15; Tank HP 80 (BT 40) to destroy one of the tanks (both tanks must be destroyed to disarm the bomb
Clockwork Poison Bomb.descriptionHazard: A clockwork bomb releases gouts of poisonous smoke. The smoke issues forth from a single nozzle attached to two tanks of pressurized poison
Clockwork Poison Bomb.disable: Three @Check[thievery|dc:31|name:Disable a Latch|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} to disable the latches that lock the nozzle in place, then one @Check[thievery|dc:35|name:Turn Off Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) check to Disable a Device to turn off the nozzle; DCs decrease by 2 if Oggvurm is immobilized, paralyzed, unconscious, or dead
Clockwork Poison Bomb.reset: The trap issues smoke for 3 minutes before its tanks run dry. The tanks must be replaced before the bomb can be reactivated.
Clockwork Poison Bomb.routine: (1 action) On its turn, the bomb spews forth a smoky gout of airborne @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.WvDbdESFJY6Be2u1]{Blackfinger Blight} poison. The cloud fills a 20-foot radius, or a 10-foot radius if only one tank remains intact. If the bomb is already in the center of a blackfinger blight cloud, the radius of that cloud increases by 20 feet (or 10 feet, if only one tank remains intact) instead.
Clockwork Poison Bomb.stealth: The bomb uses Oggvurm's initiative roll as its Stealth roll

action->Poisonous Cloud.name: Poisonous Cloud
action->Poisonous Cloud.description:
Trigger The bomb is Activated, which requires 3 actions

Effect The bomb releases a smoky cloud of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.WvDbdESFJY6Be2u1]{Blackfinger Blight} in a 20-foot radius. Creatures within the smoke are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from other creatures.

Any creature that starts its turn in the smoke must roll a @Check[fortitude|dc:32|name:Blackfinger Blight|traits:contact,virulent] saving throw to avoid being afflicted by blackfinger blight poison.

The cloud remains for 1 minute or until dispersed by strong winds.

action->Precise Tremorsense 40 feet.name: Precise Tremorsense 40 feet
action->Precise Tremorsense 40 feet.description:
The cobbleswarm's tremorsense is a precise sense out to 40 feet and an imprecise sense out to 80 feet. The cobbleswarm can't sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]

action->Grasping Bites.name: Grasping Bites
action->Grasping Bites.description:
The cobbleswarm attempts an @Check[athletics] check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of all creatures in its space.

Critical Success The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the cobbleswarm until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Success The creature falls prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the cobbleswarm until the creature until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

action->Pummeling Assault.name: Pummeling Assault
action->Pummeling Assault.description: Each enemy in the cobbleswarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

weapon->+1 Dagger.name: +1 Dagger
weapon->+1 Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

consumable->Healing Potion (Moderate).name: Healing Potion (Moderate)
consumable->Healing Potion (Moderate).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(3d8+10)[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The Copper Hand illusionist deals 2d6 additional precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

weapon->Hand Crossbow.name: Hand Crossbow
weapon->Hand Crossbow.description: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

weapon->Shortsword.name: Shortsword
weapon->Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Black Adder Venom.name: Black Adder Venom
consumable->Black Adder Venom.description:
Adder venom is a simple but effective way to enhance a weapon.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 3 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets the Copper Hand rogue with an attack, and the rogue can see the attacker

Effect The rogue dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Combustible.name: Combustible
action->Combustible.description: The first time each round that the Daemonic Infector takes fire damage, his fumes combust, dealing @Damage[30[fire]] damage to all other creatures within the area of his toxic fumes aura.

action->Toxic Fumes.name: Toxic Fumes
action->Toxic Fumes.description:
10 feet. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save.

On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute. In addition, creatures within the aura attempting a flat check to remove @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Poison Damage} must roll twice and take the lower result.

action->Opportune Dodge.name: Opportune Dodge
action->Opportune Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails a Strike against the Daemonic Rumormonger

Effect The Rumormonger dodges out of the way and uses his momentum to attack and move out of reach. He Strides up to 20 feet and can Strike at any point during this movement; this Strike counts toward the multiple attack penalty on his next turn.

action->Black Ink Delirium.name: Black Ink Delirium
action->Black Ink Delirium.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 round)

action->Breath of Lies.name: Breath of Lies
action->Breath of Lies.description:
The Daemonic Rumormonger breathes a torrent of acidic sand and poisoned ink in an @Template[line|distance:80], dealing @Damage[6d12[acid],6d12[poison]|options:area-damage]{6d12 acid damage and 6d12 poison damage} and exposing victims to his black ink delirium.

He can't use Breath of Lies again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Lies]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Whirling Slashes.name: Whirling Slashes
action->Whirling Slashes.description: The Daemonic Rumormonger Strides up to his Speed. He can make up to three claw Strikes, each against a different target, at any points during this Stride. His multiple attack penalty applies as usual.

weapon->+3 Wounding Greater Striking Cle.name: +3 Wounding Greater Striking Cleaver (Large)
weapon->+3 Wounding Greater Striking Cle.description: This single-bladed bearded axe has a jagged blade that's perfect for separating bone from tendon and cartilage.

action->Bloody Chain Aura.name: Bloody Chain Aura
action->Bloody Chain Aura.description:
20 feet. Chains of blood bind a bleeding creature to the Daemonic Skinner.

Creatures in range that are taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} can't move out of the aura.

The Skinner can have only one aura active at a time.

She can switch her active aura as an Interact action.

Dart Barrage.name: Dart Barrage
Dart Barrage.hpDetails: (BT 30) to destroy the seal and disable the trap
Dart Barrage.descriptionHazard: Four dart-loaded pipes hidden in the diagonal walls are connected to a pressure plate under the brass seal in the room's center.
Dart Barrage.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:22|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disable the pressure plate, or four @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Plug Dart Launcher|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) checks to plug the dart launchers
Dart Barrage.reset: The trap runs out of darts after 4 rounds of firing and must be reset manually by dismantling the walls to reload the launchers. If at any point there are no longer more than two creatures placing weight on the floor, the trap ceases firing but remains armed, ready to resume firing its remaining darts once triggered again.
Dart Barrage.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action for each disabled launcher. On each of the trap's actions, it fires one dart at a creature in the center of the room.
Dart Barrage.stealth: (trained) or @Check[perception|dc:23|traits:action:seek] (trained) to notice scratches around the musical pipes and a slight give to the seal

action->Dart Volley.name: Dart Volley
action->Dart Volley.description:
Trigger More than two Small or larger creatures step on the brass seal.

Effect The trap makes up to four dart Strikes against creatures standing on the seal, then rolls initiative.

action->No MAP.name: No MAP
action->No MAP.description: Darts are unaffected by Multiple Attack Penalty

weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).name: Acid Flask (Moderate)
weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 2d6 persistent acid damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->+1 Striking Sickle.name: +1 Striking Sickle
weapon->+1 Striking Sickle.description: Originally a farming tool used for reaping grain, this one-handed weapon has a short wooden handle ending in a curved blade, sometimes sharpened on both sides.

equipment->Alchemist's Tools.name: Alchemist's Tools
equipment->Alchemist's Tools.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks.

equipment->Formula Book.name: Formula Book
equipment->Formula Book.description: A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.

action->Dirty Bomb.name: Dirty Bomb
action->Dirty Bomb.description:
Requirements The chemist has at least one bomb in their possession

Effect The chemist adds a hasty mix of noxious substances to the bomb and makes a ranged Strike with it. If it hits and deals damage, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}; if the result of the save is a critical failure, this increases to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}. For the next 24 hours, the affected target takes a -2 circumstance penalty (-3 on a critical failure) to additional Fortitude saving throws against the same chemist's Crude Bombs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.5ZK22sNW7o26aST0]{Effect: Dirty Bomb}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.ryY6fdqpC5Ztnagd]{Effect: Dirty Bomb (Critical Failure)}

action->Quick Brew.name: Quick Brew
action->Quick Brew.description:
Requirements The chemist has their alchemist's tools, formula book, and a free hand

Effect The chemist creates a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Moderate Acid Flask} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire} that they must use before the end of their next turn or else it becomes inert.

weapon->+1 Morningstar.name: +1 Morningstar
weapon->+1 Morningstar.description: This weapon has a short shaft ending in a metal ball studded with spikes.

weapon->Bottled Lightning (Moderate).name: Bottled Lightning (Moderate)
weapon->Bottled Lightning (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals 2d6 electricity damage and 2 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of your next turn. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

Dreadsong Dancer.name: Dreadsong Dancer
Dreadsong Dancer.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. composition spells

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Compo.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Composition Spells

action->Arrogant Taunts.name: Arrogant Taunts
action->Arrogant Taunts.description:
The eberark utters crude insults and growls threateningly. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:27] save.

The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} and paralyzed for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Incendiary Spit.name: Incendiary Spit
action->Incendiary Spit.description:
A creature hit by the eberark's spit becomes coated in a slippery, flammable oil.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they are coated in incendiary spit.

Creatures affected by incendiary spit that take fire damage catch fire, taking @Damage[3d6[persistent,fire]] damage. Once this persistent fire damage ends, the spit has burned away.

action->Trail of Flame.name: Trail of Flame
action->Trail of Flame.description:
The eberark Strides twice, leaving a trail of magical fire behind it as it moves. Squares the eberark moves through catch fire, creating a 5-foot-tall wall of flame that burns for 1 round. The wall of flame conceals creatures and objects on the other side of it.

Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the wall of flame takes @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save).

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

action->Vein Walker.name: Vein Walker
action->Vein Walker.description: The excorion moves about by way of hundreds of pulsating blood vessels, which stretch from its body in dozens of tight, ropy bundles and anchor it to the ground. An excorion cannot be Tripped, Shoved, or otherwise forcibly moved except by magic, and the excorion ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain).

Exploding Statue.name: Exploding Statue
Exploding Statue.descriptionHazard: A hollow statue filled with explosives is connected to a trip wire running along the adjacent door.
Exploding Statue.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Safely Cut Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to safely cut the wire

action->Explosion.name: Explosion
action->Explosion.description:
Trigger A creature opens the northern door without first disabling the trip wire

Effect The statue explodes, spraying shrapnel to the west in a @Template[cone|distance:5] and dealing @Damage[(1d10+7)[piercing],1d10[fire]]{1d10+7 piercing and 1d10 fire} damage to all creatures in the affected area (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save).

Explosive Barrels.name: Explosive Barrels
Explosive Barrels.descriptionHazard: Wooden barrels marked with an oil-drop symbol catch fire and explode.
Explosive Barrels.disable: @Check[survival|dc:20|name:Smother the Flames] to smother the flames without rupturing the barrels

action->Explode.name: Explode
action->Explode.description:
Trigger 4 rounds pass after the agents' arrival without anyone smothering them

Effect The barrels explode, dealing @Damage[(3d6+8)[fire]] damage to everything within a 20-foot radius (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|traits:fire] save).

Eyeball Tank.name: Eyeball Tank
Eyeball Tank.descriptionHazard: A vat of thick glass stands 10 feet high and is filled with green slime and fist-sized eyeballs.
Eyeball Tank.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:38|name:Acidify Slime|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) or @Check[crafting|dc:34|name:Acidify Slime] (expert) to acidify the slime inside the tank, destroying the eyeballs
Eyeball Tank.routine: (3 actions) Each round, the vat uses all three of its actions to shoot random eye rays at any living creatures (except Ixusoth) in range.

action->Eye-Opener.name: Eye-Opener
action->Eye-Opener.description:
Trigger Three or more living creatures remain within 20 feet of the trap for 1 round

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

action->Spill Eyeballs.name: Spill Eyeballs
action->Spill Eyeballs.description:
Trigger The tank reaches its Broken Threshold
