Effect The glass shatters, spilling eyeballs onto the floor in a 15-foot radius and casting grease(DC 33) on the affected area. The eyeball tank is permanently destroyed and can't be reset.Reset The trap can be reset by adding 100 new eyeballs to the tank and allowing them to grow in the slime for 1 week.

False Door Trap.name: False Door Trap
False Door Trap.descriptionHazard: A hidden needle delivers a magical poison to anyone trying to open the door.
False Door Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:32|name:Jam Needle in Housing|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam the needle in its housing or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th level, counteract DC 30) to dispel the magical poison.

action->Purple Worm Sting.name: Purple Worm Sting
action->Purple Worm Sting.description:
Trigger A creature touches the door

Effect The creature is targeted by purple worm sting (@Check[fortitude|dc:32] save).

consumable->Purple Worm Venom.name: Purple Worm Venom
consumable->Purple Worm Venom.description:
Venom from enormous purple worms leaves a victim weakened.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw DC 32 Fortitude

n

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

n

Stage 1 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

n

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

action->Purple Worm Venom.name: Purple Worm Venom
action->Purple Worm Venom.description:
Venom from enormous purple worms leaves a victim weakened.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32|traits:alchemical,injury,poison]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

weapon->+1 Dagger.name: +1 Dagger
weapon->+1 Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->+1 Striking Main-Gauche.name: +1 Striking Main-Gauche
weapon->+1 Striking Main-Gauche.description: This parrying dagger features a robust guard to protect the wielder's hand.

weapon->+1 Striking Rapier.name: +1 Striking Rapier
weapon->+1 Striking Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Moderate).name: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)
consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Moderate).description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.bcxVvIbuZWOvsKcA]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)}

consumable->Jade Bauble (affixed to Main.name: Jade Bauble (affixed to Main-Gauche)
consumable->Jade Bauble (affixed to Main.description:
Activate A Command

Requirements You are a master with the affixed weapon

This bit of jade is usually carved in the shape of a duelist, or sometimes a multi-armed creature. When you activate the bauble, it magically draws the attention of foes. Until the start of your next turn, enemies within the reach of the weapon the talisman is affixed to are off-guard.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets Fayati with an attack and she can see the attacker

Effect Fayati dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Field Of Opposition.name: Field Of Opposition
Field Of Opposition.descriptionHazard: A distortion in space spawns an aggressive, malevolent shadow duplicate of any characters who pass between Terimor's faces.
Field Of Opposition.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:42|name:Disable Thievery] (legendary) to permanently disable the planar distortion (DC increases by 2 for each duplicate still extant), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level; counteract DC 42) to destroy the planar distortion

action->Spawn Mirror Duplicate.name: Spawn Mirror Duplicate
action->Spawn Mirror Duplicate.description:
Trigger A creature moves between the two glass faces of Olansa Terimor

Effect The planar rift disgorges an evil mirror duplicate of the creature, and the duplicate rolls initiative.

The field of opposition can use this reaction once per round but can't spawn a duplicate of a creature that already has a mirror duplicate in existence.

action->Mirror Duplicate.name: Mirror Duplicate
action->Mirror Duplicate.description:
A mirror duplicate rolls initiative with a +45 modifier. It uses the same statistics as the original creature, but with a +2 status bonus to AC, attacks, and saving throws. The duplicate is evil, and any abilities reliant on alignment change accordingly. The duplicate is also aggressive, attacking and taking other hostile actions available to it against anyone other than mirror duplicates.

It has three actions and one reaction and can use any of the original creature's abilities. Any limited-use abilities (such as spell slots) are based on what the original had when duplicated and are used up separately from the original creature's. The duplicate also has duplicates of the creature's worn and held items, but not consumables.

A duplicate is destroyed when reduced to 0 HP, when the trap is disabled or destroyed, or when the duplicate leaves area E2. Its duplicated items disappear when they leave its grip, though they last long enough for ranged Strikes.

Flying Guillotine.name: Flying Guillotine
Flying Guillotine.descriptionHazard: An invisible magical glyph on the guillotine's blade detects living creatures in the room, which causes the guillotine to fly off its hinges and attack.
Flying Guillotine.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Erase Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the glyph (which requires a successful unarmed attack roll if the blade is already active) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract it. The trap has a secret bypass known only to Ralso and Pratchett: as long as the guillotine can see a creature in the room touching thumb and pinky together with an empty hand, it remains dormant.
Flying Guillotine.reset: After 1 minute, the trap deactivates, though the door remains locked. The trap rearms itself each day at dawn.
Flying Guillotine.routine: (1 action) The blade @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Flies} up to 20 feet and Strikes any creatures whose squares it passes through. It cannot target the same creature more than once per round. The blade cannot be grappled and doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.

action->Flying Blade.name: Flying Blade
action->Flying Blade.description:
Trigger A living creature enters the room

Effect One round after a creature enters the room, the door to the room slams shut and locks (two Thievery checks to pick), and the guillotine blade detaches from its housing and begins flying around the room as the trap rolls initiative.

Franca Laurentz.name: Franca Laurentz
Franca Laurentz.allSavesBonus: +2 circumstance bonus to saves vs. poison

weapon->+1 Striking Crossbow.name: +1 Striking Crossbow
weapon->+1 Striking Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.name: +1 Striking Shortsword
weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

equipment->Crowbar.name: Crowbar
equipment->Crowbar.description: When Forcing Open an object that doesn't have an easy grip, a crowbar makes it easier to gain the necessary leverage. Without a crowbar, prying something open takes a -2 item penalty to the Athletics check to Force Open (similar to using a shoddy item).

Freezing Alarm.name: Freezing Alarm
Freezing Alarm.descriptionHazard: Miniature snowflake-shaped glyphs on the ground cause a layer of ice to ripple over the floor of the room and sound a silent alarm.
Freezing Alarm.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:53|name:Disable Arcana] (legendary) to draw a fiery counteracting glyph over each snowflake, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level, counteract DC 48)

action->Freeze Floor.name: Freeze Floor
action->Freeze Floor.description:
Trigger A creature enters one of the three squares marked with a T on the map

Effect The floor of the entire 10-foot-by-15-foot antechamber freezes over, sending deadly magical frost creeping up the legs of the intruders. Any creatures standing in the room must roll a @Check[reflex|dc:45] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(3d10+5)[cold]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(6d10+10)[cold]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[(12d10+20)[cold]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Additionally, the golems in area B10 become aware of the intruders. The golems activate and come to this room to attack, if they haven't been destroyed already.

weapon->Alietta (+1 Striking Bastard Swo.name: Alietta (+1 Striking Bastard Sword)
weapon->Alietta (+1 Striking Bastard Swo.description: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

weapon->+1 Spear.name: +1 Spear
weapon->+1 Spear.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

weapon->+2 Greater Striking Dagger.name: +2 Greater Striking Dagger
weapon->+2 Greater Striking Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->+2 Greater Striking Hand Crossbo.name: +2 Greater Striking Hand Crossbow
weapon->+2 Greater Striking Hand Crossbo.description: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Charming Liar.name: Charming Liar
action->Charming Liar.description:
When Gage gets a critical success using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie} action, the target's attitude toward him improves by one step, as though he'd succeeded at using Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}.

This works only once per conversation, and if he critically succeeds against multiple targets using the same result, he chooses one creature's attitude to improve.

To use this ability, Gage must be lying to impart seemingly important information, inflate his status, or ingratiate himself, which trivial or irrelevant lies can't achieve.

action->Smooth Operator.name: Smooth Operator
action->Smooth Operator.description:
When Gage meets a group of up to five people, he can immediately attempt a Diplomacy check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, comparing the result to the Will DC of each target.

He takes a -3 penalty on this check, and it is possible to get different degrees of success for each target. If he fails or critically fails, he can engage in 1 minute of conversation and attempt a new check at the end of that time rather than accepting the failure or critical failure result.

weapon->+1 Morningstar.name: +1 Morningstar
weapon->+1 Morningstar.description: This weapon has a short shaft ending in a metal ball studded with spikes.

action->Bullyrag Beatdown.name: Bullyrag Beatdown
action->Bullyrag Beatdown.description: Whenever the gang tough makes a successful melee Strike against a frightened creature, the Strike deals an extra weapon die of damage.

weapon->+2 Striking Crossbow.name: +2 Striking Crossbow
weapon->+2 Striking Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->+2 Striking Dagger.name: +2 Striking Dagger
weapon->+2 Striking Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->+2 Resilient Studded Leather Armo.name: +2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor
armor->+2 Resilient Studded Leather Armo.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Sidestep.name: Sidestep
action->Sidestep.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting the assassin fails or critically fails

Effect The assassin deftly steps out of the way of the attack. If there's another creature adjacent to the assassin and within reach of the triggering attack, the assassin redirects the attack to that adjacent creature. The attacker then rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.

action->Point Blank.name: Point Blank
action->Point Blank.description: The master assassin makes a crossbow Strike against an adjacent enemy; unlike most ranged Strikes, this Strike doesn't provoke reactions. If successful, the attack deals an additional 4d8 precision damage.

Gas Trap.name: Gas Trap
Gas Trap.descriptionHazard: A spring slams and locks the room's door before four hidden gas vents begin pumping poison gas into the chamber.
Gas Trap.disable: Four @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Block Gas Vents|traits:action:disable-a-device] checks to block the gas vents, or a @Check[thievery|dc:26|name:Unlock Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] check to unlock the door and escape
Gas Trap.reset: The trap must be manually rearmed by unblocking the vents or replacing the poison gas tank in area E30.
Gas Trap.routine:
(1 action) Each round on its initiative count, the trap pumps more toxic gas into the room.

Any breathing creature in the room takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (a successful @Check[fortitude|dc:22|traits:poison,damaging-effect] save halves the damage taken). If a creature acts before the trap on the first round, it has the option of holding its breath to postpone taking damage from the trap-holding one's breath after the trap's first action has no effect, since the air in the creature's lungs is already tainted. Locating and blocking one of the hidden gas vents reduces the poison damage by 1d6-if all four are blocked, the trap is disabled, though the door remains locked. Otherwise, the trap functions for 1 minute before all the gas is expended and characters in the room cease taking damage, after which the trap ventilates the room for 1 additional minute.
Gas Trap.stealth: (trained) to smell the poison gas or hear it hissing

action->Toxic Gas.name: Toxic Gas
action->Toxic Gas.description:
Trigger A creature opens one of the drawers

Effect The door to the room slams shut and locks and the trap rolls initiative. (The trap can also be triggered manually or disarmed from area E30.)

weapon->Greatsword.name: Greatsword
weapon->Greatsword.description: This immense two-handed sword is nearly as tall as its wielder. Its lower blade is often somewhat dulled to allow it to be gripped for extra leverage in close-quarter fights.

action->Free Blade.name: Free Blade
action->Free Blade.description:
Trigger The ghaele ends its turn while unable to act or attempts a greatsword Strike that would take a circumstance or status penalty.

Effect A ghaele's blade is implacable in the pursuit of freedom, and its energies can overpower any effect that would interfere with its swordplay.

The ghaele attempts to counteract each effect that prevents it from making a greatsword Strike, gives it a penalty to its greatsword Strike, or prevents it from acting.

The ghaele can use this ability even if it's otherwise unable to act.

action->Light Form.name: Light Form
action->Light Form.description:
A ghaele's body is partially corporeal and partially composed of light, with a color corresponding to the elemental energy currently residing in its blade (see Choose Weakness).

It can move through solid objects but can't end its action within a solid object.

action->Choose Weakness.name: Choose Weakness
action->Choose Weakness.description:
A ghaele attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about a foe they are facing.

If successful, they can change the elemental damage dealt by their greatsword and light ray to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic, usually to match the foe's weakness.

They can also change their energy resistance to any of these energy types (this can be a different type than for their attacks).

The choices remain until they next use Choose Weakness.

action->Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet
action->Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A giant bone skipper identifies bones and creatures with a skeletal system in the listed range.

action->Leaping Charge.name: Leaping Charge
action->Leaping Charge.description: The giant bone skipper @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} up to 20 feet. It then makes a mandibles Strike, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

action->Joro Spider Venom.name: Joro Spider Venom
action->Joro Spider Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d8[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} ([[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds})

action->Web Trap.name: Web Trap
action->Web Trap.description: A creature hit by the joro spider's web Strike is immobilized and stuck to the nearest surface until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 25).

action->Hypnotic Glow.name: Hypnotic Glow
action->Hypnotic Glow.description: 30 feet. Similar to other will-o'-wisps, a gloaming will-o'-wisp is naturally invisible, but glows with a faint colored light. They cast dim light in the aura, which makes them visible. In addition, any non-aberration creature that ends their turn in the aura and can see the gloaming will-o'-wisp is distracted by the gloaming will-o'-wisp's glow and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:31] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

Grabble Forden.name: Grabble Forden
Grabble Forden.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

weapon->Poisoner's Staff (Major).name: Poisoner's Staff (Major)
weapon->Poisoner's Staff (Major).description:
This gnarled staff is covered with thorns and coated with a glistening lacquer that acts as a minor irritant. While holding the staff, you aren't affected by its coating or thorns, and you reduce the DC of your flat checks to overcome persistent poison damage from 15 to 5.

Activate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell}

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrips @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.QqxwHeYEVylkYjsO]{Detect Poison}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.DYdvMZ8G2LiSLVWw]{Spider Sting}
  • 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rdTEF1hfAWbN58NE]{Enhance Victuals}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.oryfsRK27jAUnziw]{Imp Sting}
  • 3rd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GKpEcy9WId6NJvtx]{Stinking Cloud}
  • 4th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LVwmAH5NGvTuuQSU]{Swarming Wasp Stings}
  • 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MlpbeZ61Euhl0d60]{Toxic Cloud}
  • 6th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ayRXv0wQH00TTNZe]{Purple Worm Sting}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Planar Coven.name: Planar Coven
action->Planar Coven.description: As long as at least one other member of Myrna's coven is on the demiplane of Stormholt, the coven members add chain lightning, lightning bolt, plane shift, and punishing winds to their spells, each of which can be cast at up to 8th level.

action->Sea Hag's Bargain.name: Sea Hag's Bargain
action->Sea Hag's Bargain.description: The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature, who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality-such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice-in exchange for a boon or a promise from the sea hag. As long as the sea hag keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore the lost quality is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return.

action->Dread Gaze.name: Dread Gaze
action->Dread Gaze.description:
The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its Will save (DC 37). The target does not need to be able to see the sea hag.

Critical Success No effect.

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

Critical Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

action->Pull Under.name: Pull Under
action->Pull Under.description:
Requirements A creature within 60 feet of Graem or Grinlowe is in contact with the waters of Stormholt

Effect The hag casts maze (DC 37) on the creature, magically pulling the creature beneath the water (regardless of its actual depth) into an extradimensional underwater maze of shipwrecks. Between the two of them, Graem and Grinlowe can have only one creature trapped in the maze, but either hag can use the Sustain a Spell action to sustain the effect.

weapon->Greataxe.name: Greataxe
weapon->Greataxe.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded," having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

weapon->Javelin.name: Javelin
weapon->Javelin.description: This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/br 1d10 #days]] days-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

action->Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
action->Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a +27 counteract modifier.

Greater Planar Rift.name: Greater Planar Rift
Greater Planar Rift.descriptionHazard: A ragged planar rift drags things into its depths and hurls creatures through from its terminal end.
Greater Planar Rift.disable: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 46) to seal the rift

action->Greater Planar Rift.name: Greater Planar Rift
action->Greater Planar Rift.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 5 feet of the rift

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:44] save or be drawn into the rift. A creature so drawn in becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} and immediately teleports to a different random area in Kharnas's ruins.

weapon->Crossbow.name: Crossbow
weapon->Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->Katar.name: Katar
weapon->Katar.description: Also known as punching daggers, katars are characterized by their H-shaped hand grip that allows the blade to jut out from the knuckles.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

consumable->Snake Oil.name: Snake Oil
consumable->Snake Oil.description:
Activate A Interact

You can apply snake oil onto a wound or other outward symptom of an affliction or condition (such as sores from a disease or discoloration from a poison). For the next hour, the symptom disappears and the wounded or afflicted creature doesn't feel as if it still has the wound or affliction, though all effects remain. A creature can uncover the ruse by succeeding at a @Check[perception|dc:17|traits:action:seek] check, but only if it uses a Seek action to specifically examine the snake oil's effects.

consumable->Tindertwig.name: Tindertwig
consumable->Tindertwig.description:
Activate A Interact

An alchemical substance applied to one end of this tiny wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with flint and steel. You can ignite the tindertwig and touch it to a flammable object as part of the same Interact action.

action->Cheek Pouches.name: Cheek Pouches
action->Cheek Pouches.description: A ratfolk has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects. The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the Interact action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.

action->Katar Specialist.name: Katar Specialist
action->Katar Specialist.description: Gref has trained extensively with the katar blade. Any katar he wields gains the finesse trait.

action->Quick Stow.name: Quick Stow
action->Quick Stow.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Gref stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in his cheek pouches.

action->Swarming.name: Swarming
action->Swarming.description:
A ratfolk can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability.

Only two such creatures can share the same space.

action->Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
action->Unbalancing Blow.description: Any creature a grick critically hits is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against its attacks until the end of the grick's next turn.

weapon->Crossbow.name: Crossbow
weapon->Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->+2 Greater Striking Longsword.name: +2 Greater Striking Longsword
weapon->+2 Greater Striking Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

armor->Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
armor->Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment->Disguise Kit (Elite).name: Disguise Kit (Elite)
equipment->Disguise Kit (Elite).description: This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. An elite disguise kit adds a +1 item bonus to relevant checks. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Dueling Parry.name: Dueling Parry
action->Dueling Parry.description: As long as he has one free hand, Grimwold can parry attacks against him with his longsword. He gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of his next turn as long as his other hand remains free.

action->Planar Coven.name: Planar Coven
action->Planar Coven.description: As long as at least one other member of Myrna's coven is on the demiplane of Stormholt, the coven members add chain lightning, lightning bolt, plane shift, and punishing winds to their spells, each of which can be cast at up to 8th level.

action->Sea Hag's Bargain.name: Sea Hag's Bargain
action->Sea Hag's Bargain.description: The sea hag can make a bargain with a willing creature, who must be of sound mind. The creature gives away a special or cherished quality-such as its courage, its beauty, or its voice-in exchange for a boon or a promise from the sea hag. As long as the sea hag keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore the lost quality is to defeat the sea hag or make another bargain for its return.

action->Dread Gaze.name: Dread Gaze
action->Dread Gaze.description:
The hag gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom, with a result depending on its Will save (DC 37). The target does not need to be able to see the sea hag.

Critical Success No effect.

Success @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

Critical Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute. If the target was dying, it remains unconscious for 1 day. At the end of the day, it must attempt a Fortitude save against the same DC; if it fails, it dies.

action->Pull Under.name: Pull Under
action->Pull Under.description:
Requirements A creature within 60 feet of Graem or Grinlowe is in contact with the waters of Stormholt

Effect The hag casts maze (DC 37) on the creature, magically pulling the creature beneath the water (regardless of its actual depth) into an extradimensional underwater maze of shipwrecks. Between the two of them, Graem and Grinlowe can have only one creature trapped in the maze, but either hag can use the Sustain a Spell action to sustain the effect.

weapon->Lawkeeper (+1 Striking Pacifying.name: Lawkeeper (+1 Striking Pacifying Club)
weapon->Lawkeeper (+1 Striking Pacifying.description: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

weapon->Hand Crossbow.name: Hand Crossbow
weapon->Hand Crossbow.description: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

armor->Breastplate.name: Breastplate
armor->Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

equipment->Handcuffs (Good).name: Handcuffs (Good)
equipment->Handcuffs (Good).description:
Developed in Absalom and rarely used except by police forces in major cities due to their significant cost, handcuffs possess a ratcheting lock system in each cuff that allows them to be quickly cinched down on a captive's limbs, even if they're actively resisting.

To apply handcuffs, you must first grab or restrain your opponent, then attempt an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the opponent's Fortitude DC. On a success, you lock one of the cuffs around your opponent's wrist. You can lock the other cuff to yourself or a stationary object within reach as an Interact action; to lock it to another creature (either the same opponent you just cuffed or a separate creature altogether), you must first grab or restrain that creature, as before, and then make an Athletics check against its Fortitude DC. The DC to make the Athletics check against your own wrist is 5, or 10 for an unattended object.

If you bind a creature to itself, it takes the same penalties as those imposed by manacles. If you bind a creature to another creature (including yourself), the two creatures are locked together and must remain in adjacent spaces, and both creatures gain the clumsy 1 condition as long as they are handcuffed. If you lock a creature to an immobile object, such as a bar or tree, the creature is immobilized. (For creatures with an unusual physiology such as more or fewer limbs, the GM determines what effects handcuffs have, if any.)

Handcuffs are unlocked via a key and are easier to slip out of than ordinary manacles. The chain between handcuffs can be Broken Open with a single Athletics check.

Escaping requires three successful @Check[thievery|dc:30|traits:action:pick-a-lock] checks, and the Athletics DC to Break Open the chain between handcuffs is 35.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).name: Healing Potion (Lesser)
consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(2d8+5)[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Furious Pacifier.name: Furious Pacifier
action->Furious Pacifier.description: Lavarsus adds double his Strength modifier to any nonlethal melee Strikes he makes with a bludgeoning weapon.

action->Nonlethal Training.name: Nonlethal Training
action->Nonlethal Training.description:
Lavarsus has trained to take down suspects without killing them.

He can choose to make nonlethal attacks with any bludgeoning weapon without taking the usual penalty to his attack roll.

Grunka.name: Grunka
Grunka.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

weapon->Club.name: Club
weapon->Club.description: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).name: Alchemist's Fire (Lesser)
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 1d8 fire damage, 1 persistent fire damage, and 1 fire splash damage.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Goblin Scuttle.name: Goblin Scuttle
action->Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to Grunka.

Effect Grunka @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.

Hands Of The Forgotten.name: Hands Of The Forgotten
Hands Of The Forgotten.descriptionHazard: Ethereal hands stretch out from the walls and floor, attempting to restrain nearby creatures.
Hands Of The Forgotten.disable: @Check[religion|dc:30|name:Exorcise Spirits] (master) to exorcise the spirits or @Check[intimidation|dc:32|name:Scare Away the Hands|traits:action:demoralize] (expert) to scare away the hands

action->Waylay.name: Waylay
action->Waylay.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the area marked on the map

Effect Misty blue hands stretch out from the hallway's stone tiles and grasp at the triggering creature, which must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:26|traits:damaging-effect] save to avoid becoming hindered or harmed by the ethereal hands.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round and takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[void]] damage.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round and takes @Damage[(4d10+15)[void]] damage.

Hegessik.name: Hegessik
Hegessik.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. divine magic

action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 fee.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 fee.description:
A hegessik can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the hegessik the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The hegessik's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

action->+1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Div.name: +1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Divine Magic

weapon->Reaper's Lancet (Bonded Item).name: Reaper's Lancet (Bonded Item)
weapon->Reaper's Lancet (Bonded Item).description:
Hendrid Pratchett himself designed this custom skull-topped +1 striking exquisite sword cane and had it gilded in high-quality gold. Its first victim was the very smith whom Pratchett commissioned to craft the weapon, so the means of its construction are a secret known only to Pratchett. The magic of the Reaper's Lancet applies to both the blade and the sheath, making them each effectively a +1 striking weapon, but only if both are wielded by the same creature-if the two components are shared between creatures, only the blade retains the rune's magic.

Reaper's Lancet has a hidden reservoir inside the skull that automatically applies a new dose of poison to the blade after the previous dose was expended with a successful Strike. The reservoir must be filled manually (a process requiring 1 minute) and is large enough to hold only 3 doses at a time. Any sort of injury-delivered poison can be placed in it, though all doses must be of the same poison. The Price of the poison is not reflected in this weapon's listed Price.

Activate R Interact

Trigger You damage a creature with Reaper's Lancet

Effect You poison the creature you hit with the poison currently in the reservoir.

armor->Armored Coat.name: Armored Coat
armor->Armored Coat.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment->Corpseward Pendant.name: Corpseward Pendant
equipment->Corpseward Pendant.description:
This small pendant is usually shaped like a humanoid skull or small animal skull.

Activate 3 Interact

Frequency three times per day

Effect You become undetectable to undead creatures for 10 minutes. Undead can't see, hear, or smell you, nor detect you with sensory capabilities such as scent or tremorsense. A creature can attempt a single DC 18 Will saving throw to ignore this effect. If an undead has reason to believe that undetected opponents are present, it can still attempt to Seek or Strike you. If you attempt to use a vitality spell to damage undead, use Command Undead, touch or damage an undead creature, or attack any creature while warded in this manner, the pendant's effects immediately end. An undead creature who observes you in this manner or one who succeeds at the Will save is immune to the corpseward pendant for 24 hours.

consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).name: Healing Potion (Lesser)
consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(2d8+5)[healing]] Hit Points.

consumable->Hunting Spider Venom (in Rea.name: Hunting Spider Venom (in Reaper's Lancet)
consumable->Hunting Spider Venom (in Rea.description:
This venom erodes its target's defenses, aiding the spider in securing prey.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21|name:Hunting Spider Venom]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and off-guard (1 round)

action->Sword Cane Duelist.name: Sword Cane Duelist
action->Sword Cane Duelist.description: Each round, Pratchett can Strike once with each component of a sword cane without incurring the usual multiple attack penalty. Subsequent attacks incur the multiple attack penalty as usual.

Hestriviniaas.name: Hestriviniaas
Hestriviniaas.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 fee.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 fee.description:
Hestriviniaas can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Hidden Chute.name: Hidden Chute
Hidden Chute.descriptionHazard: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a stone chute.
Hidden Chute.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Remove Trapdoor|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to remove the trapdoor or lock it in position using a catch hidden inside the room's doorframe

action->Pitfall.name: Pitfall
action->Pitfall.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor

Effect The triggering creature falls 30 feet down the shaft to area E33, taking @Damage[15[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage and landing @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in the ochre jelly's pit. The creature can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to avoid falling.

The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls or Grab an Edge is 22.

Hundun Chaos Mage.name: Hundun Chaos Mage
Hundun Chaos Mage.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Hundun Chaos Mage.languagesDetails: can't speak any language, telepathy 100 feet

action->Motion Sense 100 feet.name: Motion Sense 100 feet
action->Motion Sense 100 feet.description: A hundun chaos mage can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment->Aeon Stone (Lavender and Gree.name: Aeon Stone (Lavender and Green Ellipsoid)
equipment->Aeon Stone (Lavender and Gree.description:
This functions as a pale lavender ellipsoid aeon stone, but it casts an 8th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} spell with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+31]].

The resonant power allows you to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OhD2Z6rIGGD5ocZA]{Read Aura} as arcane innate spells at will.

equipment->Brooch of Shielding.name: Brooch of Shielding
equipment->Brooch of Shielding.description:
This piece of silver or gold jewelry is adorned with miniature images of kite shields and can be used to fasten a cloak or cape.

The brooch automatically absorbs magic missile spells targeting you. A brooch of shielding can absorb 30 individual magic missiles before it melts and becomes useless. Sometimes when found, a brooch of shielding has already absorbed a number of missiles.

equipment->Ring of Spell Turning.name: Ring of Spell Turning
equipment->Ring of Spell Turning.description:
This golden ring has three diamonds set into its face.

Activate R envision

Trigger You are targeted by a spell

Effect The ring replicates the effects of an 8th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning} with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+35]], possibly causing the triggering spell to reflect back on its caster.

The ring can reflect no more than 9 total ranks of spells per day. If you activate the ring to reflect a spell that would exceed this limit, the attempt fails, but the attempted usage of the ring does not count toward the daily limit.

equipment->Rod of Wonder.name: Rod of Wonder
equipment->Rod of Wonder.description:
This peculiar rod is strange and unpredictable. Each time it is activated, it produces one of a variety of effects at random.

Activate 2 command, Interact

Effect Choose a creature within 60 feet and roll d% on the table below to determine the rod's effect. If an entry lists only a spell name, the rod casts that spell at its lowest level. You make any decisions for a spell cast by the rod unless otherwise indicated, except that it must target the creature you chose, or the creature you chose must be the center of the spell's area, if it has an area but no targets. If the spell's range is less than 60 feet, increase the range to 60 feet.

Any spell DC required is DC 27, and any spell attack roll required is [[/r 1d20+17]]. If the rod casts a spell on you, you don't get a saving throw or other defense against it.

Once activated, the rod can't be activated again for [[/r 1d4]] hours.

Roll on the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.RollTable.uYDzWM5ji52r4mSD]{Rod of Wonder} table to determine the outcome.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

Ink Drowning Vats.name: Ink Drowning Vats
Ink Drowning Vats.descriptionHazard: Steel hatch doors automatically lock shut in each of the four vats labeled J2. Four ink spouts (one per vat) jut through a narrow aperture in the ceiling of each vat, 20 feet above.
Ink Drowning Vats.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:40|name:Seal an Ink Spout|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to seal an ink spout, @Check[thievery|dc:48|name:Unlock a Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] (master) to unlock a steel hatch door, or @Check[athletics|dc:45|name:Force Open a Door|traits:action:force-open] (master) to Force Open a steel hatch door
Ink Drowning Vats.reset: The trap can be reset by refilling the ink storage tanks above the vats.
Ink Drowning Vats.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action for each disabled ink spout. On each of the trap's actions, a spout pours ink, increasing the depth of the ink in that vat by 2 feet. Creatures standing in the ink are exposed to a dose of poison ink. Once the vat is full of ink, the trap stops using actions, but creatures in the vat might start drowning.

action->Fill Tank.name: Fill Tank
action->Fill Tank.description:
Trigger The switch outside the vats is pulled

Effect The trap rolls initiative.

action->Poison Ink.name: Poison Ink
action->Poison Ink.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 3d6 poison damage and sickened 1 (1 round)

Stage 2 4d6 poison damage and sickened 2 (1 round)

Inky Tendrils.name: Inky Tendrils
Inky Tendrils.descriptionHazard: Six giant tentacles reach up from the ink lake, grabbing any foes in reach and dragging them underwater.
Inky Tendrils.disable:
@Check[athletics|dc:48|name:Disable Athletics] (legendary) or @Check[athletics|dc:45|name:Disable Acrobatics]{Acrobatics} (master) to tie one tentacle into a knot, rendering it useless, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 44) to counteract one tentacle.

The death of the Daemonic Rumormonger permanently dispels all the inky tendrils.
Inky Tendrils.routine: (6 actions) The hazard loses 1 action for every tentacle that is disabled or destroyed. The tentacles can combine their actions to use the hazard's Inky Imitator ability. A broken tentacle can still Strike, but it can't Grab. This hazard takes no multiple attack penalty.

action->Black Ink Delirium.name: Black Ink Delirium
action->Black Ink Delirium.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 round)

action->Inky Imitator.name: Inky Imitator
action->Inky Imitator.description:
The inky tendrils cast a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.73rToy0v5Ra9NvL6]{Duplicate Foe} spell (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|name:Duplicate Foe]) on the target; on a failed save, a simulacrum of the target made from dripping ink and clockwork scraps emerges from any other spot (tendrils' choice) in the lake.

The tendrils don't need to Sustain the Spell; the duplicate exists for 1 minute or until it is destroyed before collapsing into a puddle of ink and scrap metal.

action->Tendrils Come Alive.name: Tendrils Come Alive
action->Tendrils Come Alive.description:
Trigger A non-daemonic creature moves within 15 feet of the shoreline

Effect The hazard makes a tentacle Strike against the triggering creature and the hazard rolls initiative.

Iron Maiden Trap.name: Iron Maiden Trap
Iron Maiden Trap.descriptionHazard: A pressure plate hidden on the floor before an iron maiden causes the torture device to snap shut and trap the triggering creature inside.
Iron Maiden Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] to disable the pressure plate
Iron Maiden Trap.reset: The pressure plate must be reset manually.

action->Slam Shut.name: Slam Shut
action->Slam Shut.description:
Trigger A creature steps onto the trap's pressure plate (indicated on the map)

Effect The front of the iron maiden slams shut with incredible force and locks itself. The triggering creature takes @Damage[(4d10+10)[piercing]] damage and @Damage[2d6[bleed]] (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save; if the creature critically succeeds, they avoid the trap completely). The triggering creature is also immobilized. The victim can end their immobilization only once a creature outside the iron maiden unlocks the device (requiring two successful @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Unlock Iron Maiden|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] checks to Disable a Device) or breaks the iron maiden, after which the trapped creature must succeed at a DC 25 check to Escape the trap's spike-lined interior.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger The Iroran skeleton is critically hit

Effect The Iroran skeleton collapses into a pile of bones and the attack deals damage for a hit, rather than a critical hit.

The skeleton can reform in a standing position as an action, but until it does, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.

Ixusoth.name: Ixusoth
Ixusoth.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

equipment->Robe of Eyes.name: Robe of Eyes
equipment->Robe of Eyes.description:
This garment appears to be an ordinary robe until donned, at which point numerous strange and alien eyes of varied shapes and colors open and blink across its fabric. While wearing the robe, you gain a +3 item bonus to Perception checks, and you constantly benefit from the effects of a 2nd-rank see @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell.

You can also see powerful magic auras. The highest-level magic aura within 30 feet of you glows in a color that reveals its school to you and allows you to determine where the effect originates. This can narrow down the origin point of the effect to a 5-foot-cube, but not more precisely than that.

The robe of eyes is not without its dangers. If any spell with the light trait is cast on you or your square while you are wearing the robe, you are blinded for a number of rounds equal to the spell's rank unless you succeed at a Fortitude save against the spell's DC.

Activate A Interact

Effect You pluck an eye from the robe and toss it into the air, where it turns invisible and floats to a destination you choose, with the same effect as a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ek5XI0aEdZhBgm21]{Scouting Eye} spell. You can Sustain the Activation just as you would be able to Sustain the Spell.

Izfiitar.name: Izfiitar
Izfiitar.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 fe.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 feet
action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 fe.description:
A Izfiitar can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the izflitar the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The izflitar's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Jonis Flakfatter.name: Jonis Flakfatter
Jonis Flakfatter.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. disease and poison

weapon->+1 Spell Storing Dagger (contain.name: +1 Spell Storing Dagger (contains crisis of faith)
weapon->+1 Spell Storing Dagger (contain.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment->Religious Symbol (Norgorber).name: Religious Symbol (Norgorber)
equipment->Religious Symbol (Norgorber).description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Call Toxins.name: Call Toxins
action->Call Toxins.description: 30 feet. Flakfatter exudes an aura that makes poisons more potent. His melee Strikes deal an additional @Damage[2d8[persistent,poison]]. Creatures in the aura attempting a flat check to remove persistent poison damage must roll twice and take the lower result. Flakfatter can suppress or resume this aura as a free action.

weapon->+2 Striking Staff.name: +2 Striking Staff
weapon->+2 Striking Staff.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

equipment->Bracers of Armor II.name: Bracers of Armor II
equipment->Bracers of Armor II.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +2 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

weapon->Crossbow.name: Crossbow
weapon->Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->Katar.name: Katar
weapon->Katar.description: Also known as punching daggers, katars are characterized by their H-shaped hand grip that allows the blade to jut out from the knuckles.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

consumable->Snake Oil.name: Snake Oil
consumable->Snake Oil.description:
Activate A Interact

You can apply snake oil onto a wound or other outward symptom of an affliction or condition (such as sores from a disease or discoloration from a poison). For the next hour, the symptom disappears and the wounded or afflicted creature doesn't feel as if it still has the wound or affliction, though all effects remain. A creature can uncover the ruse by succeeding at a @Check[perception|dc:17|traits:action:seek] check, but only if it uses a Seek action to specifically examine the snake oil's effects.

consumable->Tindertwig.name: Tindertwig
consumable->Tindertwig.description:
Activate A Interact

An alchemical substance applied to one end of this tiny wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with flint and steel. You can ignite the tindertwig and touch it to a flammable object as part of the same Interact action.

action->Cheek Pouches.name: Cheek Pouches
action->Cheek Pouches.description: A ratfolk has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects. The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the Interact action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.

action->Katar Specialist.name: Katar Specialist
action->Katar Specialist.description: Kekker has trained extensively with the katar blade. Any katar he wields gains the finesse trait.

action->Quick Stow.name: Quick Stow
action->Quick Stow.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Kekker stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in his cheek pouches.

action->Swarming.name: Swarming
action->Swarming.description:
A ratfolk can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability.

Only two such creatures can share the same space.

effect->Spell Effect: Mage Armor.name: Spell Effect: Mage Armor
effect->Spell Effect: Mage Armor.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aAbfKn8maGjJjk2W]{Mystic Armor}

You ward yourself with shimmering magical energy, gaining a +1 item bonus to AC and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. While wearing mage armor, you use your unarmored proficiency to calculate your AC.

action->Eschew Materials.name: Eschew Materials
action->Eschew Materials.description:
You can use clever workarounds to replicate the arcane essence of certain materials. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} that requires material components, you can provide these material components without a spell component pouch by drawing intricate replacement sigils in the air.

Unlike when providing somatic components, you still must have a hand completely free. This doesn't remove the need for any materials listed in the spell's cost entry.

Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.name: Kharnas's Lesser Glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.descriptionHazard: A hidden glyph suddenly lights up and dominates the mind of any creature not bearing the sigil of Kharnas the Angel-Binder.
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.disable: Disable @Check[thievery|dc:46|name:Destroy Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to destroy the glyph, @Check[arcana|dc:42|name:Divert Glyph's Power] (master) to harmlessly divert the glyph's power, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level; counteract DC 38) to counteract the glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.reset: The glyph can affect two creatures before it deactivates for 5 minutes and automatically resets.

action->Dominate.name: Dominate
action->Dominate.description:
Trigger A creature who doesn't bear the sigil of Kharnas attempts to open the door

Effect A surge of the Radiant Spark's latent power courses through the glyph and washes over the triggering creature. If the creature is undead, it takes @Damage[10d10[vitality]] damage. If it's living, it instead regains @Damage[10d10[healing]] Hit Points. It then must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:40|traits:incapacitation,mental] save or be affected by a 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} spell.

The spell commands the affected creature to attack the nearest creature who doesn't bear the sigil of Kharnas.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment->Standard Skeleton Key.name: Standard Skeleton Key
equipment->Standard Skeleton Key.description:
A grinning skull tops the bow of this macabre key. This key can be used in place of thieves' tools when attempting to Pick a Lock, and it grants a +1 item bonus to the Thievery check.

If the skeleton key becomes broken due to a critical failure on the check, it works as normal thieves' tools and loses its benefits until repaired.

Activate F Interact

Frequency once per day

Trigger You attempt to Pick a Lock but haven't rolled yet

Effect The key casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6Ot4N22t5tPD51BO]{Knock} on the lock you're trying to pick.

action->Scurry.name: Scurry
action->Scurry.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement adjacent to Kolo

Effect Kolo Steps.

action->Upward Stab.name: Upward Stab
action->Upward Stab.description: Kolo's melee Strikes deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to Medium or larger creatures.

Lie-Master.name: Lie-Master
Lie-Master.publicNotes:
Glabrezus are looming behemoths who revel in the act of twisting mortal desires into their ultimate ruin, betraying and manipulating as easily as they breathe. Desires granted by a glabrezu always come to fruition in the most destructive way possible, turning a wish or hope into a potent and devastating act of betrayal-although the long-term repercussions are not always immediately apparent. For example, a struggling weapon smith might wish for fame and skill at their craft, only to find that their best patron is a cruel and sadistic murderer who uses the weapons in bloody sprees. Or a lonely widower might have his desire granted in the form of a lost love returned to "life" as a vampire. Glabrezus are nothing if not creative in addressing a mortal's needs.

These massive demons have enormous pincers and a pair of smaller humanoid arms sprouting from their chests, but their size belies their skill at magic, and they possess formidable innate spells. Treachery demons arise from the souls of mortals engaged in treason and deception.
Lie-Master.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

consumable->Black Dragon's Breath Potion.name: Black Dragon's Breath Potion (Wyrm)
consumable->Black Dragon's Breath Potion.description:
This liquid contains blood from a black dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a black dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[line|distance:30] of acid which deals @Damage[10d6[acid]] damage. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|name:Wyrm Black Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Truth Vulnerability.name: Truth Vulnerability
action->Truth Vulnerability.description: A glabrezu's lies sustain them, and the truth can destroy them. Whenever a revelation effect counteracts or reveals the glabrezu's illusions or the glabrezu fails a save against an effect that would prevent them from lying (such as zone of truth), the demon takes @Damage[(3d6+4)[mental]] damage. They take this damage only once per effect, even if the effect reveals multiple illusions or prevents multiple lies.

action->Captive Rake.name: Captive Rake
action->Captive Rake.description:
Requirements A creature is grabbed in the glabrezu's pincer.

Effect The glabrezu pulls the grabbed creature up to 5 feet closer, then makes two claw Strikes against it. Those Strikes count as one attack when determining a treachery demon's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both Strikes.

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: When a reaction would disrupt a glabrezu's spell, the demon can attempt a @Check[flat|dc:17] check, avoiding the disruption on a success.

action->Sudden Betrayal.name: Sudden Betrayal
action->Sudden Betrayal.description: A glabrezu can always use Deception when rolling initiative as long as they're aware of at least one opponent before initiative is rolled. When using Deception for initiative, the demon gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception.

action->Tentacle Trip.name: Tentacle Trip
action->Tentacle Trip.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet of the lie-master uses a manipulate or move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:34] save or be knocked prone by the lie-master's clockwork tentacles.

action->Treacherous Veil.name: Treacherous Veil
action->Treacherous Veil.description: A glabrezu's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} can allow it to appear as a creature of any size.

action->Twisted Desires.name: Twisted Desires
action->Twisted Desires.description: Once per month, a glabrezu can grant a mortal humanoid the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} spell granted by an Abyssal patron, though the glabrezu always perverts the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} according to their own treacherous nature.

action->Grab.name: Grab
action->Grab.description:
Requirements The monster's last action was a success with a Strike that lists Grab in its damage entry, or it has a creature grabbed using this action.

Effect The monster automatically Grabs the target until the end of the monster's next turn. The creature is grabbed by whichever body part the monster attacked with, and that body part can't be used to Strike creatures until the grab is ended. Using Grab extends the duration of the monster's Grab until the end of its next turn for all creatures grabbed by it. A grabbed creature can use the Escape action to get out of the grab, and the Grab ends for a grabbed creatures if the monster moves away from it.

Life Magnet.name: Life Magnet
Life Magnet.descriptionHazard: A magical magnet hidden behind a panel in the corner of the room pulls not metal but living creatures toward it, heedless of any obstacles in the way.
Life Magnet.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:29|name:Deactivate Panel|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to deactivate the panel, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic};(4th level; counteract DC 22) to counteract the panel's magic
Life Magnet.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no creatures touching the iron bars.
Life Magnet.routine:
(1 action) The trap pulls up to four creatures that have already triggered its Magnetize the Living ability toward one of the far corners of the room, possibly pressing them into the iron bars. If all the iron bars between an affected creature and the magnetic panel remain intact, the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:25]{DC 25 basic Fortitude} save and is restrained on a failure (Escape DC 23).

If an iron bar has been broken, the creature takes @Damage[(1d10+5)[bludgeoning]] damage instead, and if two consecutive bars have been broken the creature takes no damage (but might still be restrained on a failed save).

action->Magnetize the Living.name: Magnetize the Living
action->Magnetize the Living.description:
Trigger A creature touches any of the iron bars in this area or touches a creature already affected by the trap

Effect The magical panel hidden in the far corner of the chamber (either the western or the eastern corner, depending on which side of the room the creature was closest to when it triggered the trap) "magnetizes" the triggering creature and violently pulls it toward the corner, automatically dealing @Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning]] damage to the creature.

The trap then rolls initiative if it hasn't already done so.

action->Backdrop.name: Backdrop
action->Backdrop.description: When a creature attempts to Strike a living mural and critically misses, the attacker hits the surface (a wall, canvas, or so on) behind the living mural. This can damage or break the weapon or surface.

action->Surface-Bound.name: Surface-Bound
action->Surface-Bound.description:
A living mural can move only along flat surfaces such as floors and walls. This allows it to end its movement wrapped around corners when on a continuous surface.

If the surface it's on is destroyed (such as a portrait hit by a fireball spell or a puddle being splashed), the mural takes [[/r {10d6}]]{10d6 damage} and is shunted to the nearest flat surface. If there is no flat surface within 5 feet, the living mural is destroyed.

action->Collective Attack.name: Collective Attack
action->Collective Attack.description:
The subjects depicted within the living mural all reach out at once to attack. The living mural makes a fist Strike against each target within range.

These attacks count toward the living mural's multiple attack penalty, but this penalty doesn't increase until after all of the attacks are made.

action->Paint the Masses.name: Paint the Masses
action->Paint the Masses.description:
The living mural expels a @Template[cone|distance:15] of paint.

Creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

The living mural can't use Paint the Masses again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Paint the Masses]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Splash of Color.name: Splash of Color
action->Splash of Color.description: When the living mural hits with a splatter attack, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Living Paints.name: Living Paints
Living Paints.descriptionHazard: A mass of brushes use magical paint to convert creatures into art.
Living Paints.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:41|name:Crafting Disable] (master) to mix the paints into bland, useless colors, @Check[thievery|dc:41|name:Thievery Disable] (legendary) to dismantle the animated brushes, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 41) to counteract the magic within the paint.

action->Capture Subject.name: Capture Subject
action->Capture Subject.description:
Trigger A creature steps into the same space as the paints

Effect The brushes animate and attempt to paint all creatures within 30 feet. The creatures must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:41] save to avoid the brushes and splashes from paint cans or be converted into living artwork for 1 hour.

A creature that becomes living artwork is immediately bound to the nearest flat surface of its size or larger within 30 feet. The creature can move only along flat surfaces such as floors and walls. This allows it to end its movement wrapped around corners when on a continuous surface.

While bound to a surface, the creature can attack from its space as normal, including against other creatures bound to the same surface.

If the surface it's on is destroyed (such as a portrait hit by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} spell or a wall being demolished), the creature takes [[/r {10d6}]]{10d6 damage} and is shunted to the nearest flat surface. If there is no flat surface within 5 feet, the creature is destroyed.

weapon->+3 Greater Striking speed Handwr.name: +3 Greater Striking speed Handwraps of Mighty Blows
weapon->+3 Greater Striking speed Handwr.description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Double Punch.name: Double Punch
action->Double Punch.description: Lord Guirden makes two fist Strikes, ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after both Strikes.

action->Hurl.name: Hurl
action->Hurl.description:
Requirements Lord Guirden has a Medium or smaller creature grabbed

Effect Lord Guirden hurls the grabbed creature into a target adjacent to him. He makes a fist Strike against the adjacent target. On a success, the target and hurled creature both take 3d10+14 bludgeoning damage and are knocked prone. On a failure, only the thrown creature takes the damage and is knocked prone.

action->Master Brawler.name: Master Brawler
action->Master Brawler.description: Whenever Lord Guirden makes a fist Strike and hits, he can choose to apply either the Grab, Knockdown, or Push ability to his attack.

Lusca.name: Lusca
Lusca.publicNotes: A lusca is a predatory sea monster that resembles a three-headed shark with the body of an octopus. Ferocious electrical storms usually herald a lusca's arrival; such violent bursts of electricity result from the creature's superconductive flesh, which allows the lusca to store energy from lightning strikes that it can then discharge at foes.

weapon->Trident.name: Trident
weapon->Trident.description: This three-pronged, spear-like weapon typically has a 4-foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.

Maurrisa Jonne.name: Maurrisa Jonne
Maurrisa Jonne.allSavesBonus: +1 status bonus to saves vs. incapacitation effects, +2 status bonus to saves vs. Shove and Trip

weapon->+1 Striking Handwraps of Mighty.name: +1 Striking Handwraps of Mighty Blows
weapon->+1 Striking Handwraps of Mighty.description:
