As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.

action->+1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Inc.name: +1 Status Bonus on Saves vs. Incapacitation Effects

action->Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
action->Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The minchgorm Grabs a creature in its jaws

Effect The minchgorm uses Swallow Whole.

action->Riptide.name: Riptide
action->Riptide.description: Tentacles of water rise up and attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} all enemies within 15 feet of the minchgorm. The minchgorm attempts an @Check[athletics] check against the Fortitude DC of each creature in the area. On a success, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (Escape DC 40). On a critical success, or a success against a creature that is already grabbed, the target begins to drown.

action->Watery Simulacra.name: Watery Simulacra
action->Watery Simulacra.description: The minchgorm raises up to eight figures from nearby water, each appearing in an empty space within 60 feet of the minchgorm. A simulacrum can take any shape of size Medium or smaller that the minchgorm desires, including that of a specific individual or object, but is always plainly made of water. The minchgorm can speak, cast spells, and use its senses through its simulacra, spending actions for a simulacrum on a one-for-one basis. By using a single action with the concentrate trait, the minchgorm can cause any number of simulacra to Fly, Step, Stride, or Swim up to 60 feet. A simulacrum uses the minchgorm's AC and saving throws and has 30 Hit Points. A minchgorm can have up to eight simulacra in existence at once. Simulacra dissolve immediately when more than 60 feet from the minchgorm, or if the minchgorm dies or falls unconscious. The minchgorm can dismiss any number of its simulacra as a free action.

Miogimo.name: Miogimo
Miogimo.allSavesBonus: +1 status bonus to Will saves vs. mental effects

weapon->Crossbow.name: Crossbow
weapon->Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

weapon->+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.name: +1 Striking Composite Shortbow
weapon->+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

weapon->+1 Rapier.name: +1 Rapier
weapon->+1 Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Lesser).name: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)
consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Lesser).description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)}

consumable->Giant Centipede Venom.name: Giant Centipede Venom
consumable->Giant Centipede Venom.description:
Giant centipede venom causes severe muscle stiffness.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw DC 17 Fortitude

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

consumable->Invisibility Potion.name: Invisibility Potion
consumable->Invisibility Potion.description: An invisibility potion is colorless and oddly lightweight. Upon drinking it, you gain the effects of a 2nd-rank invisibility spell.

action->Supersonic Hearing.name: Supersonic Hearing
action->Supersonic Hearing.description: Mobana has spent years in close proximity to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.k9BYXA4b7Z4Hy6lZ]{Deafening Music Box} in her possession and is immune to its effects. She also gains a +2 circumstance bonus against sonic effects and effects that impose the deafened condition

action->Mother Venom Poison.name: Mother Venom Poison
action->Mother Venom Poison.description:
DC 38

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round).

action->Ooze Tendril.name: Ooze Tendril
action->Ooze Tendril.description: Mother Venom can command her minions and the oozes that cover her dungeon to attack foes. As long as she's conscious, she can make melee ooze tendril Strikes that originate from any slime-covered terrain in her dungeon, including the dungeon's walls and doors, or from a space occupied by one of her children of venom.

action->Spit.name: Spit
action->Spit.description: A creature hit by Mother Venom's spit attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface (Escape DC 38).

Mr. Snips.name: Mr. Snips
Mr. Snips.publicNotes: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

action->Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
action->Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by acid (@Damage[(6d10+4)[untyped]], @Damage[(2d8+4)[untyped]] from areas and persistent damage); healed by fire (area @Damage[(2d8+4)[healing]] HP); slowed by electricity

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

action->Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison
action->Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.description: Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.

action->Vulnerable to Rust.name: Vulnerable to Rust
action->Vulnerable to Rust.description: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the iron golem normally.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The iron golem exhales poisonous gas in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot radius} centered on the corner of one of the iron golem's squares.

The gas persists for 1 round. Any creature in the area (or that later enters the area) is exposed to the iron golem's poison.

The golem can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Dismember.name: Dismember
action->Dismember.description:
Whenever Mr. Snips rolls a critical hit with a scissors Strike, in addition to dealing extra damage, the golem has a chance to dismember its victim. The target must roll a @Check[reflex|dc:39|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Success No additional effect.

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d10[bleed]].

Critical Failure As failure, and one of the targets extremities is severed (the effects of this are up to the GM's discretion).

equipment->Cloak of the Bat (Greater).name: Cloak of the Bat (Greater)
equipment->Cloak of the Bat (Greater).description:
Sewn from several long strips of luxurious brown and black silk, this cloak grants you a +3 item bonus to Stealth checks as well as to Acrobatics checks to Maneuver in Flight. You can also use your feet to hang from any surface that can support your weight, without requiring any check, though you still must attempt Athletics checks to Climb in order to move around while inverted.

Activate 2 command, Interact

Frequency any number of times per day

Effect You can either transform the cloak into bat-like wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes, or have the cloak turn you into a bat by casting a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl]{Pest Form} spell on you.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.ioGzmVSmMGXWWBYb]{Effect: Cloak of the Bat}

rules.0: Cloak of the Bat, Maneuver in Flight

action->Odorless.name: Odorless
action->Odorless.description: A myrucarx emits no smell and can't be detected by scent.

action->Painful Light.name: Painful Light
action->Painful Light.description: When attempting a save against a light effect, a myrucarx gets a result one degree of success lower than it rolled. A myrucarx caught in sunlight is stunned 2 and clumsy 2.

action->Illusory Persona.name: Illusory Persona
action->Illusory Persona.description: The illusion created by the myrucarx's project image can resemble any Medium humanoid, including any specific individual it has seen, and has appropriate voice, scent, and mannerisms, allowing the myrucarx to use its Deception check to Impersonate that humanoid if it chooses.

action->Twisting Reach.name: Twisting Reach
action->Twisting Reach.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The fanged mouths at the ends of a myrucarx's tendrils twist around obstacles. The myrucarx makes two jaws Strikes against the same target, ignoring the target's cover. Both attacks count toward the myrucarx's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made. The myrucarx can't Grab as its next action after Twisting Reach.

action->Shared Diversion.name: Shared Diversion
action->Shared Diversion.description:
Trigger Another creature in the najra lizard's square succeeds at a Deception check to Create a Diversion

Effect The najra lizard automatically successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Creates a Diversion} against the same targets.

action->Najra Lizard Venom.name: Najra Lizard Venom
action->Najra Lizard Venom.description:
The creature is extremely thirsty and can't quench its thirst while poisoned

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21|traits:poison]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, and [[/r {1d4}]]{1d4 damage} that can't be recovered until the creature quenches its thirst (1 round)

Stage 2 as stage 1 (1 hour)

action->Najra Swarm Attack.name: Najra Swarm Attack
action->Najra Swarm Attack.description: The najra lizard's melee Strikes deal 1d6 precision damage to creatures sharing a square with more than one najra lizard.

Needling Stairs.name: Needling Stairs
Needling Stairs.hpDetails: to break the spring under the step and make that step safe to stand on
Needling Stairs.descriptionHazard: This staircase has springs in each step, which send poisoned needles shooting up through tiny holes in the wood when stepped on. Each step, 6 in total, takes up one 5-foot square.
Needling Stairs.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:33|name:Disable Stair Spring|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on each stair to disable its spring, or deactivate the switch in area C8 to deactivate the whole trap. Cutting the wire on the topmost stair (>@Check[thievery|dc:35|name:Cut Wire on Top-Most Stair|traits:action:disable-a-device] to Disable the Device) that connects the staircase to the control switch prevents the control switch from turning the trap on or off.
Needling Stairs.reset: If deactivated via the switch, the trap can be reactivated with the switch in area C8.
Needling Stairs.routine: (1 action) The trap makes a separate poisoned needle Strike against each creature currently on an active step as 1 action. Because it is constantly jabbing needles up through any weight-bearing steps, the trap can also use its Bloody Feet free action to jab at a creature on one of the steps during that creature's turn.

action->First Step.name: First Step
action->First Step.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement on one of the stairs

Effect The trap makes a poisoned needle Strike against the triggering creature, then rolls initiative.

strike-melee->Poisoned Needle.name: Poisoned Needle
strike-melee->Poisoned Needle.description: No MAP applies to strikes made by poisoned needle attacks

action->Bloody Feet.name: Bloody Feet
action->Bloody Feet.description:
Trigger A creature moves onto an active step

Effect The trap makes a poisoned needle Strike against the triggering creature.

action->No MAP.name: No MAP
action->No MAP.description: The Poisoned Needle Strikes do not apply a MAP.

Nenchuuj.name: Nenchuuj
Nenchuuj.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.name: +1 Striking Shortsword
weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment->Thieves' Tools (Infiltrator).name: Thieves' Tools (Infiltrator)
equipment->Thieves' Tools (Infiltrator).description:
You need thieves' tools to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Locks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable Devices} (of some types) using the Thievery skill. Infiltrator thieves' tools add a +1 item bonus to checks to Pick Locks and Disable Devices.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.BznmPaRjI4Orb0IH]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action. If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

action->Waves of Sorrow.name: Waves of Sorrow
action->Waves of Sorrow.description: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it is overwhelmed by the sorrow that suffuses the obrousian's being. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

condition->Slowed.name: Slowed
condition->Slowed.description: You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Corpse Wallow.name: Corpse Wallow
action->Corpse Wallow.description: The ofalth zombie gains fast healing 2 as long as it is in the Catacombs or another area with a high concentration of dead.

spell->Teleport (At Will) (Self Only) (O.name: Teleport (At Will) (Self Only) (Only within Terimor's Tower)

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment->Whisper of the First Lie.name: Whisper of the First Lie
equipment->Whisper of the First Lie.description:
This delicate necklace contains bottled whispers distilled from a source on the Astral Plane rumored to be connected to the first lie ever told.

While wearing the necklace, you gain a +3 item bonus to Deception checks, and you can attempt to counteract effects that would force you to tell the truth or determine whether you are lying.

Success on this counteract attempt lets you ignore the effect, rather than removing the effect entirely. The counteract rank is 9, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+35]].

Activate 3 Interact, envision, command

Effect You unstopper the vial and release the lie, creating the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6s0UW4bujggma9TC]{Fabricated Truth} (DC 47). The vial is emptied and can never be activated again.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of fabricated truth.

Overdrive Imentesh.name: Overdrive Imentesh
Overdrive Imentesh.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 fee.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
action->Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 fee.description:
An overdrive imentesh can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the overdrive imentesh the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The overdrive imentesh's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Pelmo.name: Pelmo
Pelmo.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

weapon->Club.name: Club
weapon->Club.description: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).name: Alchemist's Fire (Lesser)
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 1d8 fire damage, 1 persistent fire damage, and 1 fire splash damage.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Goblin Scuttle.name: Goblin Scuttle
action->Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to Pelmo.

Effect Pelmo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.

Penqual.name: Penqual
Penqual.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

spell->Mask of Terror (See Crush of Hund.name: Mask of Terror (See Crush of Hundreds)

action->Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
action->Easy to Call.description: The sahkil is considered 2 levels lower for the purposes of being summoned by rituals (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle}), but is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Combustible.name: Combustible
action->Combustible.description: The first time each round that a pickled punk takes fire damage, its fumes combust, dealing @Damage[5[fire]] damage to all other creatures within the area of its Suffocating Fumes aura.

action->Suffocating Fumes.name: Suffocating Fumes
action->Suffocating Fumes.description:
5 feet. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save, or @Check[fortitude|dc:17] if the pickled punk is attached to the creature.

On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

Plunger Chute.name: Plunger Chute
Plunger Chute.descriptionHazard: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a hidden chute, and a moving section of wall shoves victims into it.
Plunger Chute.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|name:Jam the Trapdoor Shut|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the trapdoor shut or activate a hidden bypass switch by twisting a fitting on the gas lamp

action->Pitfall and Plunger.name: Pitfall and Plunger
action->Pitfall and Plunger.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the trapdoor

Effect Anyone within 10 feet of the room's northern wall falls 40 feet down the shaft to area E33, taking @Damage[20[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage and landing @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in the ochre jelly's pit.

The victims can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to avoid falling.

The DC to Grab an Edge is 20; the DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls is 22.

action->Toxin-Inured.name: Toxin-Inured
action->Toxin-Inured.description: A poison eater can't gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition from poisons.

action->Consume Poison.name: Consume Poison
action->Consume Poison.description:
The poison eater uses an Interact action to draw a dose of poison and eats it, gaining strength.

The poison-eater's Strikes deal two weapon dice of damage rather than one. The poison eater is affected by the consumed poison normally and, therefore, usually chooses poisons mitigated by their poison resistance and toxin-inured ability.

At the end of each of their turns, the poison eater attempts a @Check[flat|dc:17|name:Consumed Poison Metabolizes] check; on a success, this ability ends.

rules.0: The Poison Eater has Consumed a Poison

Poisoned Dart Statue.name: Poisoned Dart Statue
Poisoned Dart Statue.descriptionHazard: Countless poison darts fire from holes in the statues and walls of this hall.
Poisoned Dart Statue.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Trap|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel deactivates the trap.
Poisoned Dart Statue.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Poisoned Dart Statue.routine: (1 action) The trap launches one dart against every creature in the hall as 1 action. Because it launches darts continuously, the trap can also use the Continuous Barrage free action (see below) to launch darts at each creature during that creature's turn. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Poisoned Dart Statue.stealth: (expert) or @Check[perception|dc:39|traits:action:seek] (master) to notice the control panel. Anyone specifically searching the name plate of Abresha Tallow-Hands locates the control panel automatically.

action->Dart Volley.name: Dart Volley
action->Dart Volley.description:
Trigger A creature makes noise in the hall, which can be avoided with a successful @Check[stealth|dc:28|name:Avoid Notice|traits:action:sneak,move,secret] check

Effect The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature, then rolls initiative.

action->Continuous Barrage.name: Continuous Barrage
action->Continuous Barrage.description:
Trigger A creature within the hallway finishes an action while the trap is active

Effect The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Terinav Root Poison.name: Terinav Root Poison
action->Terinav Root Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:28]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 4d6 poison damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

Stage 2 5d6 poison damage, clumsy 2, and -5-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 round)

Stage 3 7d6 poison damage, clumsy 2, and -10-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 round)

weapon->+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.name: +1 Striking Composite Shortbow
weapon->+1 Striking Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->+1 Leather Armor.name: +1 Leather Armor
armor->+1 Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment->Religious Symbol (norgorber).name: Religious Symbol (norgorber)
equipment->Religious Symbol (norgorber).description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

consumable->Arrows With Shadow Essence.name: Arrows With Shadow Essence
consumable->Arrows With Shadow Essence.description:
These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

Infused with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Wjkw0lEUOhypYvzo]{Shadow Essence}

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Toxic Mastery.name: Toxic Mastery
action->Toxic Mastery.description: Kalyn can masterfully manipulate vile, poisonous energy and increase its potency. Her melee and ranged Strikes deal an additional 2d6 poison damage, and a target that takes this poison damage has a -1 status penalty to saving throws against Kalyn's divine spells for 1 round. Poisons delivered by Kalyn have the virulent trait.

Prospecti Statue.name: Prospecti Statue
Prospecti Statue.publicNotes: As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

weapon->+1 Longsword (Huge).name: +1 Longsword (Huge)
weapon->+1 Longsword (Huge).description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description: Like normal objects, a giant animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a giant animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.

Pulping Golem.name: Pulping Golem
Pulping Golem.publicNotes: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

action->Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
action->Golem Antimagic.description:
Harmed by acid (@Damage[(6d10+4)[untyped]], @Damage[(2d8+4)[untyped]] from areas and persistent damage); healed by fire (area @Damage[(2d8+4)[healing]] HP); slowed by electricity

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GolemAntimagic]

action->Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.name: Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison
action->Vulnerable to Neutralize Poison.description: Casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} on the golem deactivates its Breath Weapon for 1 minute.

action->Vulnerable to Rust.name: Vulnerable to Rust
action->Vulnerable to Rust.description: Magical rusting effects, like a rust monster's antennae, affect the iron golem normally.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The pulping golem spills its cauldron stomach to the floor, dealing @Damage[9d12[fire]] damage to creatures within 10 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Extend Legs.name: Extend Legs
action->Extend Legs.description: The pulping golem extends its legs up to a height of 40 feet, raising its body high into the air. While its legs are extended, its movement speed is halved, and it takes a -2 penalty to its Fortitude save DC against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} attempts.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->Shortsword.name: Shortsword
weapon->Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment->Caltrops.name: Caltrops
equipment->Caltrops.description: These four-pronged metal spikes can cause damage to a creature's feet. You can scatter caltrops in an empty square adjacent to you with an Interact action. The first creature that moves into that square must succeed at a @Check[acrobatics|dc:14|name:Avoid Caltrops] check or take 1d4 piercing damage and @Damage[1[bleed]] damage. A creature taking persistent bleed damage from caltrops takes a -5-foot penalty to its Speed. Spending an Interact action to pluck the caltrops free reduces the DC to stop the bleeding. Once a creature takes damage from caltrops, enough caltrops are ruined that other creatures moving into the square are safe. Deployed caltrops can be salvaged and reused if no creatures took damage from them. Otherwise, enough caltrops are ruined that they can't be salvaged.

equipment->Ring of Discretion.name: Ring of Discretion
equipment->Ring of Discretion.description: This ring magically conceals any armor and sheathed weapons you're wearing by either turning them invisible or creating the illusion of ordinary clothes. The ring doesn't change your appearance beyond concealing weapons and armor. As soon as you wield a weapon, the weapon becomes obvious to onlookers and is no longer affected by the ring until you sheathe the weapon for at least 1 minute. A creature can disbelieve this illusion by Seeking or any time it hits you with an attack.

consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).name: Healing Potion (Lesser)
consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(2d8+5)[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Double Stab.name: Double Stab
action->Double Stab.description:
Requirements Ralso is wielding two piercing weapons

Frequency once per round

Effect Ralso makes two Strikes against a single creature within reach, one Strike per weapon.

These attacks count toward Ralso's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Ralso deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Clockwork Reconstruction.name: Clockwork Reconstruction
action->Clockwork Reconstruction.description: Each time Reginald is reborn in his lair, his machines graft him with a new clockwork modification. He chooses one of his abilities with the clockwork trait. He gains access to this ability but can't use any of his other clockwork abilities. He can't choose the same ability twice in a row. He begins with Ink Blood active.

action->Ink Blood.name: Ink Blood
action->Ink Blood.description:
Reginald's body is filled with toxic ink

Trigger An adjacent creature Strikes Reginald with a melee weapon or unarmed attack and deals damage

Effect The creature is exposed to Reginald's poison ink.

action->Secret of Rebirth.name: Secret of Rebirth
action->Secret of Rebirth.description: If a creature with less than 5 Secret Knowledge points reduces Reginald to 0 HP (or dealt the last damage to him before he dies from using Overdrive Engine), Reginald's body dissipates into a puddle of ink and releases a black wave of psychic energy. Each creature within 30 feet is bathed in a torrent of forbidden secrets and gains 1 Secret Knowledge point. Reginald's body reforms [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} later in his sanctum at full health at a location of his choosing (typically the Pool of Secrets, area L11). This ability activates automatically with no action necessary on Vancaskerkin's behalf.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description: Reginald's lungs are equipped with ink canisters, allowing him to spew a @Template[line|distance:60] of ink that deals @Damage[9d6[poison]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:39|basic] save; on a failure, the creature is also subjected to Reginald's poison ink).

action->Overdrive Engine.name: Overdrive Engine
action->Overdrive Engine.description:
Reginald is equipped with clockwork organs to power his body

Requirements Reginald has 175 Hit Points or fewer

Effect Reginald gains 200 temporary Hit Points, a +15-foot status bonus to Speed, and a +2 status bonus to melee attack rolls. His body begins to overheat, spewing steam that deals @Damage[9d6[fire]] damage at the beginning of his turn to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). After 2 rounds, Reginald explodes, dealing @Damage[19d6[fire]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). Reginald dies. For the purposes of his Secret of Rebirth ability, the last creature to damage Reginald counts as killing him.

action->Poison Ink.name: Poison Ink
action->Poison Ink.description:
Reginald is immune to the toxic ink that flows through his veins

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 round).

action->Quill Cannon.name: Quill Cannon
action->Quill Cannon.description: Reginald is equipped with a cannon and hundreds of steel quills. He makes two steel quill attacks against every creature in a @Template[cone|distance:60], ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after all attacks are made. He can't use Quill Cannon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Quill Cannon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Reflective Plating.name: Reflective Plating
action->Reflective Plating.description: Reginald engages his defensive plating, which casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning} on him (counteract modifier +32).

action->Slither.name: Slither
action->Slither.description: With his body composed of ink and gears, Reginald can move through tight spaces as if he were a Tiny creature, treating them as difficult terrain.

Rhevanna.name: Rhevanna
Rhevanna.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

weapon->Spiked Chain.name: Spiked Chain
weapon->Spiked Chain.description: This 4-foot-long length of chain is covered with barbs and has spikes on one or both ends. Some feature metal hoops used as handgrips.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Rigged Cubby.name: Rigged Cubby
Rigged Cubby.descriptionHazard: A hidden string connected to precariously stacked bricks causes the cubby to collapse in on itself when the string is pulled.
Rigged Cubby.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Cut String|traits:action:disable-a-device] to cut the string without setting off the trap

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature touches the sickle in the cubby

Effect The heavy bricks above the cubby collapse, leaving the sickle unscathed but dealing @Damage[(4d6+10)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save) to the triggering creature.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->+2 Greater Striking War Razor.name: +2 Greater Striking War Razor
weapon->+2 Greater Striking War Razor.description: A war razor is an exaggerated version of the barbers' tool. It is a brittle but extremely sharp weapon that is very easy to slip into a pocket or sleeve.

armor->+2 Resilient Studded Leather Armo.name: +2 Resilient Studded Leather Armor
armor->+2 Resilient Studded Leather Armo.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment->Necklace of Fireballs VI.name: Necklace of Fireballs VI
equipment->Necklace of Fireballs VI.description:
This string of beads appears to be a hemp string with lustrous red beads of various sizes hanging from it. When activated, it briefly appears in its true form: a golden chain with golden spheres attached by fine threads.

This necklace has one @Damage[16d6[fire]] damage, three @Damage[14d6[fire]] damage and four @Damage[12d6[fire]] damage beads with a Reflex save DC of 36. When all the beads are gone, the necklace becomes a non-magical hemp string.

Activate A Interact

Effect You detach a sphere from the necklace, causing it to glow with orange light. After you activate a sphere, if you or anyone else hurls it (an Interact action with the ranged trait), it detonates as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} where it lands. Your toss can place the center of the fireball anywhere within 70 feet, though at the GM's discretion you might need to make an attack roll if the throw is unusually challenging. If no one hurls the sphere by the start of your next turn, it turns into a non-magical red bead.

action->Bloody Mayhem.name: Bloody Mayhem
action->Bloody Mayhem.description: Sad Liza Strides three times. Once per Stride, she can attempt a war razor Strike against a creature in her reach at any point during the Stride; she must make each Strike against a different creature, but she doesn't apply her multiple attack penalty until after making all her Strikes. If any of the Strikes are a critical failure, Bloody Mayhem immediately ends.

action->Close Cutter.name: Close Cutter
action->Close Cutter.description: Whenever Sad Liza deals slashing damage, the target takes an additional 2d10 persistent bleed damage.

weapon->+1 Striking Dagger.name: +1 Striking Dagger
weapon->+1 Striking Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

equipment->Wand of Manifold Missiles (3r.name: Wand of Manifold Missiles (3rd-Rank Spell)
equipment->Wand of Manifold Missiles (3r.description:
This wand features a carved dragon's head at its top and a polished metal sphere set in its midsection.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} at 3rd rank.

After you cast the spell, an additional missile or missiles are released from the wand at the start of each of your turns, as though you cast the 1-action version of magic missile. Choose targets each time. This lasts for 1 minute, until you're no longer wielding the wand, or until you try to activate the wand again.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of magic missile of the appropriate rank.

action->Drain Wand.name: Drain Wand
action->Drain Wand.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Scathka hasn't acted yet on their turn

Effect On their turn, Scathka casts one spell they've prepared and already cast this day without spending a spell slot. Scathka must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

action->Throw Shadow Blade.name: Throw Shadow Blade
action->Throw Shadow Blade.description:
Requirement Scathka is wielding a dagger

Effect Scathka draws a shadowy glyph on the dagger's blade and flings it at a nearby foe. Scathka makes a ranged Strike with the dagger with the range increment to 30 feet.

If the Strike hits, it deals @Damage[8d6[cold]] damage (double damage on a critical success) and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn (or [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} on a critical failure).

The dagger loses its shadowy magic as soon as the attack is resolved.

Secret-Keeper.name: Secret-Keeper
Secret-Keeper.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. mental

weapon->+2 Striking Dagger.name: +2 Striking Dagger
weapon->+2 Striking Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

shield->Sturdy Shield (Moderate).name: Sturdy Shield (Moderate)
shield->Sturdy Shield (Moderate).description:
With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

The shield has Hardness 13, HP 104, and BT 52.

armor->Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
armor->Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment->Cape of the Mountebank.name: Cape of the Mountebank
equipment->Cape of the Mountebank.description:
This bright red-and-gold cape is often interlaced with glittery threads and serves as a distraction. While wearing the cape, you gain a +2 item bonus to Deception checks.

Activate 2 Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}. The space you leave and the one you appear in are filled with puffs of smoke that make anyone within concealed until they leave the smoke or the end of your next turn, at which point the smoke dissipates. Strong winds immediately disperse the smoke.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Divert Strike.name: Divert Strike
action->Divert Strike.description:
Trigger A shatterling takes non-bludgeoning damage and there's an unbroken mirror at least 1 foot wide within 100 feet of the shatterling

Effect The nearest mirror to the shatterling at least 1 foot wide breaks, and the damage to the shatterling is reduced to 0.

action->Extra Reaction.name: Extra Reaction
action->Extra Reaction.description: A shatterling gains an additional reaction each turn, but can use this extra reaction only for Divert Strike.

action->Mirror Senses.name: Mirror Senses
action->Mirror Senses.description: A shatterling can see and hear through any unbroken mirror within 100 feet.

action->Blood-Fueled Titter.name: Blood-Fueled Titter
action->Blood-Fueled Titter.description: If the shatterling attempts an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a target within 30 feet of a creature with persistent bleed damage, the shatterling has +4 circumstance bonus to the Intimidation check. In addition, the shatterling takes no penalty to the check for not speaking a language the target can hear, and the target isn't temporarily immune to the shatterling's attempts to Demoralize it unless the shatterling critically fails its Intimidation check.

weapon->Javelin.name: Javelin
weapon->Javelin.description: This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.

weapon->+1 Striking Scimitar.name: +1 Striking Scimitar
weapon->+1 Striking Scimitar.description: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

shield->Wooden Shield.name: Wooden Shield
shield->Wooden Shield.description:
Though they come in a variety of shapes and sizes, the protection offered by wooden shields comes from the stoutness of their materials. While wooden shields are less expensive than steel shields, they break more easily.

Hardness HP BT
3 12 6

consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Moderate).name: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)
consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Moderate).description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.bcxVvIbuZWOvsKcA]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)}

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: A Shikwashim mercenary can hold their breath for 20 minutes.

action->Coordinated Distraction.name: Coordinated Distraction
action->Coordinated Distraction.description:
With a sharp whistle or wave of their hand, the mercenary distracts an opponent so one of the mercenary's allies can land a clean blow.

The mercenary chooses a target and an ally, both of whom must be within 30 feet of the mercenary. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the first Strike the mercenary's ally makes on its next turn; if the ally doesn't Strike that target, the effect is lost.

Depending on how the mercenary distracts their foe, this action gains either the auditory or visual trait.

action->Human Hunter.name: Human Hunter
action->Human Hunter.description: A Shikwashim mercenary's multiple attack penalty for attacks against humans is -3 (-2 with an agile weapon) on their second attack per turn or -6 (-4 with an agile weapon) on their third or subsequent attack per turn.

action->Compression.name: Compression
action->Compression.description: When a shredskin successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezes}, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not difficult terrain for a shredskin.

action->Control Body.name: Control Body
action->Control Body.description:
Requirements The shredskin is adjacent to a Medium or Small humanoid-shaped corpse

Effect The shredskin wraps itself around the corpse and takes control of the host body. While controlling a host, the shredskin uses the host's Speed but its own attacks, and it loses its Grab and Enshroud abilities.

Attacks that target the shredskin while it controls a body deal half of the damage to the shredskin and half of the damage to the host body. Attacks that target an area deal damage to both the shredskin and host body normally.

The shredskin can release the host body as a free action at the start of its turn. If the host is destroyed, the shredskin automatically releases the body and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. A Medium corpse typically has 15 hit points, while a Small corpse typically has 10 Hit Points.

Creatures can notice that a corpse is controlled by a shredskin by succeeding a Perception check against the shredskin's Deception DC.

action->Enshroud.name: Enshroud
action->Enshroud.description:
Requirements The shredskin is grabbing a creature

Effect The shredskin attempts to pin the creature and wrap itself around the creature like a shirt. The shredskin rolls an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

On a success, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} and the shredskin can take control of the creature as if using Control Body.

At the start of its turn, the shredskin can automatically Constrict the enshrouded creature as a free action.

An enshrouded creature can attempt a DC 16 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} check to break free (DC 18 if the shredskin critically succeeded its Athletics check to Enshroud).

equipment->Handcuffs (Average).name: Handcuffs (Average)
equipment->Handcuffs (Average).description:
Developed in Absalom and rarely used except by police forces in major cities due to their significant cost, handcuffs possess a ratcheting lock system in each cuff that allows them to be quickly cinched down on a captive's limbs, even if they're actively resisting.

To apply handcuffs, you must first grab or restrain your opponent, then attempt an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the opponent's Fortitude DC. On a success, you lock one of the cuffs around your opponent's wrist. You can lock the other cuff to yourself or a stationary object within reach as an Interact action; to lock it to another creature (either the same opponent you just cuffed or a separate creature altogether), you must first grab or restrain that creature, as before, and then make an Athletics check against its Fortitude DC. The DC to make the Athletics check against your own wrist is 5, or 10 for an unattended object.

If you bind a creature to itself, it takes the same penalties as those imposed by manacles. If you bind a creature to another creature (including yourself), the two creatures are locked together and must remain in adjacent spaces, and both creatures gain the clumsy 1 condition as long as they are handcuffed. If you lock a creature to an immobile object, such as a bar or tree, the creature is immobilized. (For creatures with an unusual physiology such as more or fewer limbs, the GM determines what effects handcuffs have, if any.)

Handcuffs are unlocked via a key and are easier to slip out of than ordinary manacles. The chain between handcuffs can be Broken Open with a single Athletics check.

Escaping requires two successful @Check[thievery|dc:27|traits:action:pick-a-lock] checks, and the Athletics DC to Break Open the chain between handcuffs is 30.

treasure->Victor's Medallion from the Ch.name: Victor's Medallion from the Challenge of Sky and Heaven

action->Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
action->Flurry of Blows.description:
Shristi makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purposes of resistances and weaknesses. He applies his multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

As it has the flourish trait, Shristi can use Flurry of Blows only once per turn.

action->Heaven's Thunder.name: Heaven's Thunder
action->Heaven's Thunder.description:
Frequency twice per day

Effect With a loud shout, Shristi unleashes his ki as a crackling shroud of thunder and lightning that engulfs his body. Until the end of his next turn, Shristi's unarmed Strikes and Strikes with weapons that have the monk trait deal an additional 3 electricity damage and 3 sonic damage.

action->Exorcism.name: Exorcism
action->Exorcism.description:
Mental damage ignores a siege shard's hardness.

Additionally, proving the siege shard's generative conflict is over with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Ma93dpT4K7JbP9gu]{Prove Peace} activity reverts the creature to ordinary stone.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

action->Distracting Shadows.name: Distracting Shadows
action->Distracting Shadows.description: Skebs can use creatures that are at least one size larger than themself as cover for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} actions.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Skebs deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->+1 Shortsword.name: +1 Shortsword
weapon->+1 Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

weapon->War Razor.name: War Razor
weapon->War Razor.description: A war razor is an exaggerated version of the barbers' tool. It is a brittle but extremely sharp weapon that is very easy to slip into a pocket or sleeve.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment->Religious Symbol (Silver) of.name: Religious Symbol (Silver) of Norgorber
equipment->Religious Symbol (Silver) of.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

equipment->Skinsaw Mask.name: Skinsaw Mask
equipment->Skinsaw Mask.description:
A patchwork of humanoid flesh makes up this grotesque mask stitched together with black silk or wire. It is distinctive for its bulbous orange eye- crafted from a magical glass bauble-and wide row of teeth.

When worn, the mask amplifies your ability to sense fear in other creatures.

You automatically know the value of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition of any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} creature, and you gain a +1 item bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} frightened creatures. Whenever you deal precision damage to a frightened creature, you deal 1 additional precision damage.

If you are not evil, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} while wearing the Skinsaw mask.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: When attacking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature, the Skinsaw murderer deals 1d6 additional precision damage.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.name: +1 Striking Shortsword
weapon->+1 Striking Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

weapon->War Razor.name: War Razor
weapon->War Razor.description: A war razor is an exaggerated version of the barbers' tool. It is a brittle but extremely sharp weapon that is very easy to slip into a pocket or sleeve.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment->Religious Symbol (Silver) of.name: Religious Symbol (Silver) of Norgorber
equipment->Religious Symbol (Silver) of.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

equipment->Skinsaw Mask.name: Skinsaw Mask
equipment->Skinsaw Mask.description:
A patchwork of humanoid flesh makes up this grotesque mask stitched together with black silk or wire. It is distinctive for its bulbous orange eye- crafted from a magical glass bauble-and wide row of teeth.

When worn, the mask amplifies your ability to sense fear in other creatures.

You automatically know the value of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition of any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.1wQY3JYyhMYeeV2G]{Observed} creature, and you gain a +1 item bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} frightened creatures. Whenever you deal precision damage to a frightened creature, you deal 1 additional precision damage.

If you are not evil, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} while wearing the Skinsaw mask.

action->Wire Catch.name: Wire Catch
action->Wire Catch.description:
Every Skinsaw seamer keeps a sewing needle attached to a loop of thick silk, wrapped loosely around their hand not holding a weapon, which they can use in combat to snag or disarm attackers

Trigger A creature hits the seamer with a melee Strike

Effect The seamer attempts an Athletics check to either [[/act grapple]] or [[/act disarm]] the triggering creature.

action->Flay.name: Flay
action->Flay.description:
Requirements The Skinsaw seamer dealt damage with a melee weapon other than its war razor with their last action

Effect The seamer makes a war razor Strike against the same creature that they just damaged. On a hit, the seamer slices a strip of flesh from the target and deals @Damage[1d6[bleed]] in addition to the war razor's usual damage.

action->Pest Haven.name: Pest Haven
action->Pest Haven.description:
The rotting hides and molding straw stuffing of skitterstitches are ideal nesting grounds for vermin and insect swarms. Any animal swarm sharing a space with a skitterstitch gains fast healing 3.

Additionally, if a creature deals at least 10 piercing or slashing damage to the skitterstitchstitch, the swarm can use its swarming bites Strike (or similar attack) against the attacker as a reaction.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.CM14G9kLI97aIC5h]{Effect: Pest Haven}

action->Spider Swarm Host.name: Spider Swarm Host
action->Spider Swarm Host.description: Skitterstitches host a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.NcYbJS5PWBGdNDqh]{Spider Swarm} within themselves, which erupts out when the Skitterstitch is destroyed

action->Flay.name: Flay
action->Flay.description: The skitterstitch makes a blade Strike against an animal or humanoid. On a success, the skitterstitch slices a long strip of flesh from the target; if the skitterstitch dealt damage, it deals an additional 1d6 persistent bleed damage.

weapon->Composite Shortbow.name: Composite Shortbow
weapon->Composite Shortbow.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

weapon->Sap.name: Sap
weapon->Sap.description: A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon's purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.

weapon->+1 Striking Temple Sword.name: +1 Striking Temple Sword
weapon->+1 Striking Temple Sword.description: This heavy blade is favored by guardians of religious sites. It has a distinctive, crescent-shaped blade that seems to be a mix of a sickle and sword. It often has holes drilled into the blade or the pommel so that bells or other holy trinkets can be affixed to the weapon as an aid for prayer or mediation.

shield->Steel Shield.name: Steel Shield
shield->Steel Shield.description:
Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

Hardness HP BT
5 20 10

armor->Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
armor->Chain Mail.description: A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Attack of Opportunity.name: Attack of Opportunity
action->Attack of Opportunity.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Wary.name: Wary
action->Wary.description: The veteran isn't off-guard to hidden creatures and always gains a +4 circumstance bonus to their Perception DC against creatures attempting to Create a Diversion or Lie to the veteran.

action->Power Attack.name: Power Attack
action->Power Attack.description: The veteran makes a melee Strike that counts as two attacks when calculating their multiple attack penalty. If this strike hits, it deals an extra die of weapon damage.

action->Swipe.name: Swipe
action->Swipe.description: The veteran makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within their melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the veteran's multiple attack penalty.

action->Transparent.name: Transparent
action->Transparent.description:
A slithering rift is so clear that it's difficult to spot. A successful @Check[perception|dc:48] check is required to notice a stationary slithering rift, and a creature must be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Searching} to attempt this check.

A creature that walks into the rift's space might fall into any pit currently in effect due to Dimensional Pit.

action->Breach Vulnerability.name: Breach Vulnerability
action->Breach Vulnerability.description:
Ingesting an extradimensional space like that found in a bag of holding deals @Damage[12d8[force]] damage to the slithering rift and its occupants.

The slithering rift then immediately uses Out You Go.

action->Dimensional Pit.name: Dimensional Pit
action->Dimensional Pit.description:
The slithering rift opens an extradimensional, 20-foot-deep pit that covers its own space and all adjacent squares unless they are walls or similarly blocking terrain.

Any other creature occupying spaces in the pit must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:40|traits:damaging-effect] save or fall into the pit, taking damage from the fall (typically @Damage[10[bludgeoning]|options:fall-damage] damage). Any creature grabbed by the ooze is released from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.i18TlebMzwONyPhI]{Grab} and falls in, even if it was outside the pit squares.

While the pit is open, the slithering rift is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and can't be forced to move. It can make pseudopod Strikes originating from the walls of the pit. A creature that starts its turn at the bottom of the pit takes @Damage[5d6[acid]] damage.

Creatures can climb the walls with a @Check[athletics|dc:40|name:Climb Out of the Rift|traits:action:climb] check. When the slithering rift dies, the pit closes and creatures inside are ejected, as Out you Go.

action->Flurry of Pods.name: Flurry of Pods
action->Flurry of Pods.description:
The slithering rift makes a single pseudopod Strike against each target within range it hasn't already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

These attacks count toward the slithering rift's multiple attack penalty, but this penalty doesn't increase until after all of these attacks.

action->Out You Go.name: Out You Go
action->Out You Go.description:
The slithering rift closes all pit spaces it created using Dimensional Pit, ejecting all its occupants onto the ground into random free spaces where the opening of the pit was.

Each occupant takes @Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save).

Sordesdaemon.name: Sordesdaemon
Sordesdaemon.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

weapon->+1 Striking Crossbow.name: +1 Striking Crossbow
weapon->+1 Striking Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->Thunderstone (Greater).name: Thunderstone (Greater)
weapon->Thunderstone (Greater).description:
When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 3d4 sonic damage and 3 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 28.

Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).name: Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil)
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).descriptionHazard: A summoning circle inlaid into the room's floor detects living creatures and summons a violent devil.
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).disable: @Check[perception|dc:18|name:Notice the Trap's Magic|traits:action:seek] to notice the trap's magic and avoid stepping on the floor outside the circle, followed by @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Break Summoning Circle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to break the circle or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 23) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

action->Summon Devil.name: Summon Devil
action->Summon Devil.description:
Trigger A living creature steps on any part of the floor not enclosed by the summoning circle

Effect One round after a creature touches the triggering area, the door to the room slams shut and locks (two Thievery checks to pick) and a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.FIoRPHaHdYUPVKdT]{Barbazu} devil appears in the summoning circle.

The devil rolls initiative and remains for [[/br 3d6 #rounds]]{3d6 rounds}, after which the spell ends and the devil disappears. The devil also disappears if someone disables the trap before the duration expires.

The summoned devil can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).name: Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat)
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).descriptionHazard: An invisible cloud of magical sensors detects living creatures in the room and summons fire elementals to slay the creatures.
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:22|name:Approach Rune] (trained) to approach without triggering the trap, followed by @Check[thievery|dc:22|name:Erase Summoning Rune|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the rune or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

action->Summon Elementals.name: Summon Elementals
action->Summon Elementals.description:
Trigger A living creature enters the room

Effect Two rounds after a creature enters the room, the room's door slams shut and locks (two Thievery checks to pick), and two @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xN5J9S485LxFZMkL]{Cinder Rat} fire elementals emerge from the floor.

The elementals roll initiative and remain for [[/gmr 3d6 #rounds]]{3d6 rounds}, after which the spell ends and the creatures disappear. The elementals also disappear if someone disables the trap before the duration expires.

The summoned elementals can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

Supplicant Statues.name: Supplicant Statues
Supplicant Statues.descriptionHazard: Six statues rapidly slide around the room on rollers, slowing down intruders and striking at them with spring-loaded sword arms.
Supplicant Statues.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Statue Rollers|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a specific statue's rollers, or @Check[thievery|dc:39|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel in A4 deactivates the whole trap. For each statue disabled, the trap loses 1 action from its routine and the DC for its predictive impediment ability decreases by 4. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level, counteract DC 32) doesn't harm the statues but removes the predictive impediment ability. Breaking the control panel prevents the trap from resetting.
Supplicant Statues.reset: The trap deactivates and resets one minute after the room is empty.
Supplicant Statues.routine: (6 actions) On the trap's initiative, each functioning statue slides up to 40 feet around the room and makes a statue shortsword Strike against an adjacent creature. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty, and the statues' movements don't trigger reactions.

action->Animated Statues.name: Animated Statues
action->Animated Statues.description:
Trigger A creature enters a square adjacent to a statue

Effect The trap makes a statue shortsword Strike against the triggering creature, activates its predictive impediment ability, and then rolls initiative.

action->Predictive Impediment.name: Predictive Impediment
action->Predictive Impediment.description: The statues continually slide around to bump into creatures and block their passage through the room. The first time on its turn that a creature attempts to move within the room, it must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:36] save or treat the entire room as difficult terrain for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is also knocked prone.

weapon->Crossbow.name: Crossbow
weapon->Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

weapon->+1 Striking Elven Curve Blade.name: +1 Striking Elven Curve Blade
weapon->+1 Striking Elven Curve Blade.description: Essentially a longer version of the scimitar, this traditional elven weapon has a thinner blade than its cousin.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

consumable->Graveroot.name: Graveroot
consumable->Graveroot.description:
The opaque white sap from the graveroot shrub clouds the mind.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and stupefied 2 (1 round)

action->Shadow Step.name: Shadow Step
action->Shadow Step.description:
The svartalfar killer fades into shadow, Strides up to twice its Speed, and reforms.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions, but the svartalfar killer must begin and end in an area of dim light or darkness.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: A svartalfar killer deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Obscuring Grab.name: Obscuring Grab
action->Obscuring Grab.description: While the tenome is Grabbing a creature, all other creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to the tenome.

action->Bone Drink.name: Bone Drink
action->Bone Drink.description:
Requirement The tenome has a creature grabbed or restrained

Effect The tenome makes a jaws Strike against the grabbed or restrained creature. If the Strike hits, the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or the value of the creature's drained condition increases by 1 if it already has a drained value, to a maximum of drained 4).

The tenome regains @Damage[1d8[healing]] Hit Points each time it uses Bone Drink.

action->Burst of Speed.name: Burst of Speed
action->Burst of Speed.description:
The tenome Strides twice, Steps twice, or Steps and Strides (in either order).

It cannot use Burst of Speed again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Terrifying Gaze.name: Terrifying Gaze
action->Terrifying Gaze.description:
1 or 2 actions

A tenome can gaze at a creature within 30 feet by presenting one of its eyes. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. If the tenome uses 2 actions and presents both of its eyes, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} if it fails the save.

A creature that successfully saves is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

action->Emotion Sense 120 feet.name: Emotion Sense 120 feet
action->Emotion Sense 120 feet.description: A teraphant can sense the emotions of creatures within 120 feet as an imprecise sense. Emotion sense is a precise sense against creatures under an emotion effect. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} can't be noticed via emotion sense.
